Posts.title: Three Knives Best Chef Award!
Posts.content:
Our warmest congratulations to @chef_julien on being awarded Three Knives once again by @thebestchefawards.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we’ve long admired from around the world.

As we take this time to refresh our space and experience, this honour is a timely reminder of why we do what we do—and it fills us with hope and inspiration for the season ahead.

Posts.title: Pinot Noir Grape
Posts.content:
Back in 2012, we hosted a wine event with the world-renowned vineyard Chateau d’Yquem, for which our chefs and sommelier collaborated to create a dish that captured the aroma and flavour profile of what noble rot—Botrytis Cinerea—develops in their legendary Sauternes. The complexity of the wine was matched by the complexity of the dish: the recipe has 55 stages in its preparation.

This year, we’re hosting another prestigious wine dinner, with the equally world-renowned vineyard, Domaine de la Romanée-Conti. In honour of their expression of the Pinot Noir grape, Heston and his development team, pastry chefs and sommeliers were busy creating a brand-new version of this epic dessert, this time inspired by the complex characteristics of Pinot Noir.

Pinot Noir Grape will be featured on our à la carte menu from 18th July.

Posts.title: Cooking with Bro
Posts.content:
Dans les coulisses de notre cuisine La Table de Pavie ✨ .
Voici un aperçu de la magie qui opère derrière le passe : entre passion, précision et créativité. Les chefs @yannickalleno et @sebastien_faramond_ véritables architectes du goût, mettent un point d’honneur à équilibrer les saveurs, à soigner les cuissons, et surtout... à maîtriser l’art des sauces .

Posts.title: Nid d’abeille
Posts.content: Le Chocolat en alvéole, thé hojicha cubebe, miel amer de Corse.

Posts.title: Invitation to an exceptional gastronomic journey
Posts.content:
On November 13th and 14th, @lemeuricealainducasse restaurant will host a unique four-hand dinner, conceived by the Dom Pérignon Society chefs, @amaurybouhours and @qiqedacosta , alongside Maison @domperignonofficial .
Following an initial encounter in Spain, a unique sensory experience will come to life, highlighting the dialogue between haute French and Spanish cuisine around tactility, inspired by Dom Pérignon vintages.
A celebration of excellence and creativity. ✨

Enjoy responsibly

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we’ve long admired from around the world.

As we take this time to refresh our space and experience, this honour is a timely reminder of why we do what we do—and it fills us with hope and inspiration for the season ahead.

Post.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Post.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

Posts.title: Pinot Noir Grape
Posts.content:
Back in 2012, we hosted a wine event with the world-renowned vineyard Chateau d’Yquem, for which our chefs and sommelier collaborated to create a dish that captured the aroma and flavour profile of what noble rot—Botrytis Cinerea—develops in their legendary Sauternes. The complexity of the wine was matched by the complexity of the dish: the recipe has 55 stages in its preparation.

This year, we’re hosting another prestigious wine dinner, with the equally world-renowned vineyard, Domaine de la Romanée-Conti. In honour of their expression of the Pinot Noir grape, Heston and his development team, pastry chefs and sommeliers were busy creating a brand-new version of this epic dessert, this time inspired by the complex characteristics of Pinot Noir.

Pinot Noir Grape will be featured on our à la carte menu from 18th July.

Posts.title: Cooking with Bro
Posts.content:
Dans les coulisses de notre cuisine La Table de Pavie ✨ .
Voici un aperçu de la magie qui opère derrière le passe : entre passion, précision et créativité. Les chefs @yannickalleno et @sebastien_faramond_ véritables architectes du goût, mettent un point d’honneur à équilibrer les saveurs, à soigner les cuissons, et surtout... à maîtriser l’art des sauces .

Post.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Post.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

Courses.ingredients: beef tenderloin, puff pastry, mushrooms, prosciutto, Dijon mustard, egg yolk, garlic, shallots, thyme, butter, salt, black pepper, olive oil
Courses.description: Beef Wellington is a classic British dish featuring a tender beef fillet coated with mushroom duxelles and wrapped in crispy puff pastry. It’s a show-stopping centerpiece for special occasions and requires careful preparation to achieve the perfect balance of juicy beef and golden pastry.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

sections.content: Beef Wellington is an iconic dish often served at festive occasions and high-end restaurants. The dish combines a perfectly seared beef tenderloin with a layer of savory mushroom duxelles and prosciutto, all encased in buttery puff pastry. Achieving the right cooking temperature is critical: the beef should be medium-rare, the mushrooms cooked down, and the pastry golden and crisp. Timing, preparation, and attention to detail make this dish a rewarding culinary experience.

1.Trim and season beef tenderloin with salt and black pepper. Sear on all sides in hot oil until browned. Brush with Dijon mustard and let cool.

2.Finely chop mushrooms, shallots, and garlic. Cook in butter with thyme until moisture evaporates, forming mushroom duxelles. Let cool.

3.Lay prosciutto slices on plastic wrap, spread mushroom duxelles on top, and place beef in the center. Wrap tightly and chill for 15–30 minutes.

4.Roll out puff pastry. Place beef and prosciutto-duxelles on the pastry and wrap completely, sealing edges. Brush with egg yolk.

5.Chill wrapped beef briefly to firm up the pastry. Score the top lightly for decoration.

6.Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (400°F) for 25–30 minutes or until pastry is golden and beef reaches medium-rare (about 54°C / 130°F).

7.Let rest 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with pan sauce or red wine jus.
http://localhost:5037/sections/d30a58b9-c440-42b1-a676-e1780e614177.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cyskqnp1j64

quizQuestions.question: What type of meat is traditionally used for Beef Wellington?
What is the purpose of the mushroom duxelles?
quizQuestions.option4: Prevent the pastry from getting soggy
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: Prevent the pastry from getting soggy

quizQuestions.question: Which step is critical for achieving a medium-rare beef inside?
What is traditionally wrapped around the beef before puff pastry?

Courses.ingredients: whole chicken, milk, butter, garlic, lemon, fresh sage, salt, black pepper
Courses.description: Jamie Oliver’s Chicken in Milk is a comforting roast chicken recipe that stays tender and juicy. The milk, butter, garlic, and lemon infuse the chicken with subtle flavors while creating a delicious sauce.

sections.content: This classic Jamie Oliver recipe involves roasting a whole chicken in milk with aromatics like garlic, lemon, and sage. The milk keeps the chicken moist while the lemon and garlic give a gentle tangy and savory flavor. Perfect for family dinners or special occasions.

1.Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Pat the chicken dry. Slice lemon and peel garlic cloves.

2.Melt butter in a roasting pan. Add garlic, lemon slices, and sage. Place the chicken in the pan.

3.Pour milk over the chicken until it reaches halfway up the bird. Season with salt and black pepper.

4.Roast in the oven for 1 hour 20 minutes, basting occasionally with milk and juices.

5.Remove chicken, let it rest for 10 minutes, then carve. Serve with sauce and roasted vegetables.
http://localhost:5037/sections/c1b1274f-165f-4efb-a04a-507d624fa9eb.jpeg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H8h0kbBFo2I

quizQuestions.question: What ingredient keeps the chicken moist in this recipe?
Which herb is used for flavoring?
How long should the chicken roast in the oven?
What is used for basting the chicken?

Courses.ingredients: spaghetti, cherry tomatoes, garlic, fresh basil, olive oil, Parmesan cheese, salt, black pepper
Courses.description: Jamie Oliver’s Spaghetti Pomodoro is a quick, classic Italian pasta dish. Fresh tomatoes, garlic, and basil create a simple yet flavorful sauce perfect for any weeknight dinner.

sections.content: Spaghetti Pomodoro is all about simplicity and freshness. Jamie Oliver emphasizes using ripe cherry tomatoes, fresh basil, and high-quality olive oil to create a vibrant, quick pasta sauce. The dish highlights the beauty of Italian cooking: minimal ingredients, maximum flavor.

1.Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.

2.Heat olive oil in a pan. Sauté minced garlic until fragrant.

3.Add cherry tomatoes and cook until they soften and release juices. Season with salt and black pepper.

4.Drain spaghetti and add to the pan. Toss with fresh basil and grated Parmesan.

5.Serve hot with extra Parmesan and a drizzle of olive oil.
http://localhost:5037/sections/7343b181-05af-4608-8969-ce1ac11db875.webp
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lWaBh-r2ZP0

quizQuestions.question: Which ingredient adds freshness to Spaghetti Pomodoro?
What type of cheese is used in this recipe?
How long does it take to cook this dish?
Which step releases the flavor from garlic?

Courses.courseName: Seared Sea Bass with Fennel and Citrus
Courses.ingredients: sea bass fillets, fennel, oranges, lemons, olive oil, butter, salt, black pepper, fresh herbs (thyme, parsley), white wine
Courses.description: Alain Ducasse’s seared sea bass dish highlights delicate flavors with a combination of fresh citrus, tender fennel, and perfectly cooked fish. This elegant dish balances light, aromatic ingredients with precise cooking techniques.

Posts.title: Invitation to an exceptional gastronomic journey
Posts.content:
On November 13th and 14th, @lemeuricealainducasse restaurant will host a unique four-hand dinner, conceived by the Dom Pérignon Society chefs, @amaurybouhours and @qiqedacosta , alongside Maison @domperignonofficial .
Following an initial encounter in Spain, a unique sensory experience will come to life, highlighting the dialogue between haute French and Spanish cuisine around tactility, inspired by Dom Pérignon vintages.
A celebration of excellence and creativity. ✨

Enjoy responsibly

sections.content: Seared sea bass is a hallmark of Ducasse’s refined cuisine. The fish is lightly seasoned and cooked to retain moisture, while fennel is braised with citrus to provide a fragrant, slightly sweet complement. White wine and butter enrich the sauce, and fresh herbs elevate the final presentation, demonstrating the French mastery of flavor and technique.

1.Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Clean and trim fennel; slice thinly.

2.Heat olive oil and butter in a pan. Add fennel and sauté for 3–4 minutes.

3.Add white wine, salt, and black pepper; simmer until fennel is tender.

4.Season sea bass fillets with salt and pepper. Sear skin-side down in hot oil until golden, then finish in oven for 5–7 minutes.

5.Slice oranges and lemons; add to fennel pan briefly to warm.

6.Plate fennel with citrus slices, place seared sea bass on top, drizzle pan sauce, and garnish with fresh herbs.
http://localhost:5037/sections/19e88439-b8da-4dca-991d-0eef6cb5587c.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eJFfHu9NZdY

quizQuestions.question: What is the key vegetable used in this dish?
Which citrus fruits are used?
What is critical for perfect seared sea bass?
Which ingredient enriches the sauce?

Courses.description: Alain Ducasse’s chocolate fondant is a decadent dessert with a molten center. Served with smooth caramel sauce, it combines rich chocolate flavor with a velvety texture, perfect for an impressive dessert course.

sections.content: Chocolate fondant is a classic French dessert popularized by Alain Ducasse for its perfect molten center. Precision in baking time and ingredient ratios ensures a gooey core with a firm outer layer. Paired with a silky caramel sauce, this dessert balances bitterness from dark chocolate with sweetness from caramel, offering a luxurious finish to any meal.

1.Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Butter and flour small ramekins.

2.Melt dark chocolate and butter together over a double boiler.

3.Beat eggs with sugar until pale and fluffy. Fold in chocolate mixture carefully.

4.Sift in flour and gently fold until smooth.

5.Pour batter into prepared ramekins. Bake for 10–12 minutes until edges are set but center remains soft.

6.Prepare caramel sauce by melting sugar in a pan until golden, then add cream and a pinch of salt, stirring until smooth.

7.Serve fondants immediately, drizzled with caramel sauce.
http://localhost:5037/sections/8fe695ca-e192-430a-b405-104df061b770.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6B55jaBuwEU

quizQuestions.question: What type of chocolate is used in this fondant?
How long is the fondant baked?
What gives the dessert a molten center?
quizQuestions.option1: Baking at high temperature for short time
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: Baking at high temperature for short time

quizQuestions.question: What is added to the caramel sauce to balance sweetness?

Courses.description: Nigel Ng’s Egg Fried Rice is a simple yet flavorful dish combining fluffy eggs, aromatic garlic, and spring onions with perfectly cooked rice. This dish is quick, satisfying, and a staple in many Asian kitchens.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we’ve long admired from around the world.

sections.content: Egg Fried Rice is a classic comfort food. Nigel Ng emphasizes using day-old rice for the best texture, ensuring the grains stay separate and fluffy. Quick stir-frying with eggs, garlic, and spring onions creates a balance of savory and aromatic flavors. Soy sauce and sesame oil finish the dish with depth and umami.

1.Use day-old rice and break up any clumps.

2.Heat oil in a wok or pan over high heat. Sauté minced garlic until fragrant.

3.Push garlic to the side, crack eggs into the pan, and scramble until just set.

4.Add rice, toss to combine, breaking up clumps.

5.Add soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, and black pepper to taste.

6.Stir in chopped spring onions and cook for 1–2 minutes. Serve hot.
http://localhost:5037/sections/b9cce2ae-15ac-49d1-bbd2-9cf25afdf650.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SGBP3sG3a9Y

quizQuestions.question: Why is day-old rice preferred for fried rice?
Which ingredient adds umami flavor?
When are the spring onions added?
What type of oil is commonly used?

Courses.description: Nigel Ng’s Pho is a fragrant Vietnamese beef noodle soup with a rich, aromatic broth made from simmered bones and spices. Served with tender beef, fresh herbs, and lime, it’s a perfect combination of savory, sweet, and umami flavors.

sections.content: Pho is Vietnam’s national dish, and Nigel Ng’s version emphasizes a clear, flavorful broth. Slow-simmering beef bones with spices such as star anise, cinnamon, and cloves creates depth of flavor. Fresh herbs, lime, and chili are added at the table to personalize the soup. The combination of tender noodles, thinly sliced beef, and aromatic broth makes this dish iconic.

1.Roast beef bones in the oven for 30 minutes to develop flavor.

2.Char onion and ginger over an open flame or broil in the oven.

3.In a large pot, add bones, onion, ginger, star anise, cloves, cinnamon, and water. Simmer 3–4 hours.

4.Strain broth, season with fish sauce, sugar, and salt.

5.Cook rice noodles according to package instructions.

6.Arrange noodles and thin slices of raw beef in a bowl. Pour hot broth over to cook the beef.

7.Garnish with cilantro, basil, lime, chili, and bean sprouts. Serve immediately.
http://localhost:5037/sections/4cd574df-30c9-4ce4-be3d-0bad877d46f4.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z8f15a5IpBk

quizQuestions.question: What is the main ingredient for Pho broth?
Which spice is NOT typically used in Pho?
Why are onions and ginger charred?
quizQuestions.option1: To remove bitterness and enhance flavor
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: To remove bitterness and enhance flavor

quizQuestions.question: How is the thin beef cooked in Pho?
quizQuestions.option3: Cooked by pouring hot broth over it
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: Cooked by pouring hot broth over it

Courses.ingredients: lobster tails, shallots, champagne, heavy cream, butter, olive oil, salt, white pepper, chives, lemon juice
Courses.description: Anne-Sophie Pic’s lobster dish showcases delicate seafood with a luxurious champagne cream sauce. This elegant dish balances the natural sweetness of lobster with a silky, aromatic sauce, perfect for a fine dining experience.

Posts.title: Pinot Noir Grape
Posts.content:
Back in 2012, we hosted a wine event with the world-renowned vineyard Chateau d’Yquem, for which our chefs and sommelier collaborated to create a dish that captured the aroma and flavour profile of what noble rot—Botrytis Cinerea—develops in their legendary Sauternes. The complexity of the wine was matched by the complexity of the dish: the recipe has 55 stages in its preparation.

This year, we’re hosting another prestigious wine dinner, with the equally world-renowned vineyard, Domaine de la Romanée-Conti. In honour of their expression of the Pinot Noir grape, Heston and his development team, pastry chefs and sommeliers were busy creating a brand-new version of this epic dessert, this time inspired by the complex characteristics of Pinot Noir.

Pinot Noir Grape will be featured on our à la carte menu from 18th July.

sections.content: This recipe highlights Pic’s mastery of flavors, combining the sweetness of lobster with a light yet rich champagne sauce. The shallots add depth, while cream and butter create a luxurious texture. Precision in cooking the lobster ensures it stays tender, and the sauce is balanced to enhance—not overpower—the seafood.

1.Boil lobster tails for 5–6 minutes until just cooked. Remove meat and set aside.

2,Finely chop shallots and sauté in butter and olive oil until soft.

3.Deglaze pan with champagne and reduce by half.

4.Add heavy cream, salt, white pepper, and a squeeze of lemon juice. Simmer until sauce thickens.

5.Add lobster meat back to pan to warm gently.

6.Plate lobster and drizzle with champagne sauce. Garnish with finely chopped chives.
http://localhost:5037/sections/cbf62efc-6e42-4fbd-ac6a-c3f37be0e5c1.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lA4OQssT-Gc

quizQuestions.question: Which ingredient gives richness to the sauce?
How long should lobster be cooked?
Why is champagne added?
What herb is used for garnish?

Courses.ingredients: quail, black truffle, chicken stock, shallots, butter, olive oil, garlic, thyme, salt, black pepper
Courses.description: This elegant dish from Anne-Sophie Pic features tender roasted quail paired with a rich truffle jus. The combination of earthy truffle, aromatic herbs, and perfectly cooked game bird exemplifies haute French cuisine.

Posts.title: Pinot Noir Grape
Posts.content:
Back in 2012, we hosted a wine event with the world-renowned vineyard Chateau d’Yquem, for which our chefs and sommelier collaborated to create a dish that captured the aroma and flavour profile of what noble rot—Botrytis Cinerea—develops in their legendary Sauternes. The complexity of the wine was matched by the complexity of the dish: the recipe has 55 stages in its preparation.

This year, we’re hosting another prestigious wine dinner, with the equally world-renowned vineyard, Domaine de la Romanée-Conti. sections.content: Roasted quail with truffle jus is a refined dish emphasizing precision and balance. Quail is delicate, requiring careful roasting to retain moisture, while the truffle jus adds depth and an earthy aroma. Anne-Sophie Pic’s style combines meticulous technique with simplicity in ingredients, highlighting the natural flavors of each component.

1.Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Clean quail and pat dry, season with salt and black pepper.

2.Heat olive oil and butter in a pan. Sear quail on all sides until golden brown.

3.Remove quail, sauté chopped shallots and garlic until fragrant.

4.Deglaze pan with chicken stock, add thyme, and simmer to reduce into a jus.

5.Shave or grate black truffle into the jus, stir gently.

6.Roast quail in the oven for 8–10 minutes until cooked through.

7.Plate quail and drizzle with truffle jus. Serve with seasonal vegetables or a light puree.
http://localhost:5037/sections/b5d7af01-f714-4452-90e0-6f2830e242c6.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3ptxpMWJRd0

quizQuestions.question: What is the key ingredient that gives the jus its earthy aroma?
How is the quail initially cooked to get color?
What is the purpose of deglazing the pan?
How long should quail be roasted after searing?

The dish combines a perfectly seared beef tenderloin with a layer of savory mushroom duxelles and prosciutto, all encased in buttery puff pastry. Achieving the right cooking temperature is critical: the beef should be medium-rare, the mushrooms cooked down, and the pastry golden and crisp. Timing, preparation, and attention to detail make this dish a rewarding culinary experience.

course.ingredients: beef tenderloin, puff pastry, mushrooms, prosciutto, Dijon mustard, egg yolk, garlic, shallots, thyme, butter, salt, black pepper, olive oil
course.description: Beef Wellington is a classic British dish featuring a tender beef fillet coated with mushroom duxelles and wrapped in crispy puff pastry. It’s a show-stopping centerpiece for special occasions and requires careful preparation to achieve the perfect balance of juicy beef and golden pastry.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

sections.content:
1.Trim and season beef tenderloin with salt and black pepper. Sear on all sides in hot oil until browned. Brush with Dijon mustard and let cool.

2.Finely chop mushrooms, shallots, and garlic. Cook in butter with thyme until moisture evaporates, forming mushroom duxelles. Let cool.

3.Lay prosciutto slices on plastic wrap, spread mushroom duxelles on top, and place beef in the center. Wrap tightly and chill for 15–30 minutes.

4.Roll out puff pastry. Place beef and prosciutto-duxelles on the pastry and wrap completely, sealing edges. Brush with egg yolk.

5.Chill wrapped beef briefly to firm up the pastry. Score the top lightly for decoration.

6.Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (400°F) for 25–30 minutes or until pastry is golden and beef reaches medium-rare (about 54°C / 130°F).

7.Let rest 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with pan sauce or red wine jus.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cyskqnp1j64

CourseSections.content:
1.Trim and season beef tenderloin with salt and black pepper. Sear on all sides in hot oil until browned. Brush with Dijon mustard and let cool.

2.Finely chop mushrooms, shallots, and garlic. Cook in butter with thyme until moisture evaporates, forming mushroom duxelles. Let cool.

3.Lay prosciutto slices on plastic wrap, spread mushroom duxelles on top, and place beef in the center. Wrap tightly and chill for 15–30 minutes.

4.Roll out puff pastry. Place beef and prosciutto-duxelles on the pastry and wrap completely, sealing edges. Brush with egg yolk.

5.Chill wrapped beef briefly to firm up the pastry. Score the top lightly for decoration.

6.Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (400°F) for 25–30 minutes or until pastry is golden and beef reaches medium-rare (about 54°C / 130°F).

7.Let rest 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with pan sauce or red wine jus.

course.ingredients: beef tenderloin, puff pastry, mushrooms, prosciutto, Dijon mustard, egg yolk, garlic, shallots, thyme, butter, salt, black pepper, olive oil
course.description: Beef Wellington is a classic British dish featuring a tender beef fillet coated with mushroom duxelles and wrapped in crispy puff pastry. It’s a show-stopping centerpiece for special occasions and requires careful preparation to achieve the perfect balance of juicy beef and golden pastry.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

sections.content: Beef Wellington is an iconic dish often served at festive occasions and high-end restaurants. The dish combines a perfectly seared beef tenderloin with a layer of savory mushroom duxelles and prosciutto, all encased in buttery puff pastry. Achieving the right cooking temperature is critical: the beef should be medium-rare, the mushrooms cooked down, and the pastry golden and crisp. Timing, preparation, and attention to detail make this dish a rewarding culinary experience.
http://localhost:5037/sections/d30a58b9-c440-42b1-a676-e1780e614177.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cyskqnp1j64

quizQuestions.option4: Prevent the pastry from getting soggy
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: Prevent the pastry from getting soggy

What is traditionally wrapped around the beef before puff pastry?

sections.content: Beef Wellington is an iconic dish often served at festive occasions and high-end restaurants. The dish combines a perfectly seared beef tenderloin with a layer of savory mushroom duxelles and prosciutto, all encased in buttery puff pastry. Achieving the right cooking temperature is critical: the beef should be medium-rare, the mushrooms cooked down, and the pastry golden and crisp. Timing, preparation, and attention to detail make this dish a rewarding culinary experience.

1.Trim and season beef tenderloin with salt and black pepper. Sear on all sides in hot oil until browned. Brush with Dijon mustard and let cool.

2.Finely chop mushrooms, shallots, and garlic. Cook in butter with thyme until moisture evaporates, forming mushroom duxelles. Let cool.

3.Lay prosciutto slices on plastic wrap, spread mushroom duxelles on top, and place beef in the center. Wrap tightly and chill for 15–30 minutes.

4.Roll out puff pastry. Place beef and prosciutto-duxelles on the pastry and wrap completely, sealing edges. Brush with egg yolk.

5.Chill wrapped beef briefly to firm up the pastry. Score the top lightly for decoration.

6.Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (400°F) for 25–30 minutes or until pastry is golden and beef reaches medium-rare (about 54°C / 130°F).

7.Let rest 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with pan sauce or red wine jus.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cyskqnp1j64

quizQuestions.option4: Prevent the pastry from getting soggy
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: Prevent the pastry from getting soggy

quizQuestions.question: Which step is critical for achieving a medium-rare beef inside?
What is traditionally wrapped around the beef before puff pastry?

course.ingredients: beef tenderloin, puff pastry, mushrooms, prosciutto, Dijon mustard, egg yolk, garlic, shallots, thyme, butter, salt, black pepper, olive oil
course.description: Beef Wellington is a classic British dish featuring a tender beef fillet coated with mushroom duxelles and wrapped in crispy puff pastry. It’s a show-stopping centerpiece for special occasions and requires careful preparation to achieve the perfect balance of juicy beef and golden pastry.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

CourseSections.content: This classic Jamie Oliver recipe involves roasting a whole chicken in milk with aromatics like garlic, lemon, and sage. The milk keeps the chicken moist while the lemon and garlic give a gentle tangy and savory flavor. Perfect for family dinners or special occasions.

course.ingredients: whole chicken, milk, butter, garlic, lemon, fresh sage, salt, black pepper
course.description: Jamie Oliver’s Chicken in Milk is a comforting roast chicken recipe that stays tender and juicy. The milk, butter, garlic, and lemon infuse the chicken with subtle flavors while creating a delicious sauce.

sections.content:
1.Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Pat the chicken dry. Slice lemon and peel garlic cloves.

2.Melt butter in a roasting pan. Add garlic, lemon slices, and sage. Place the chicken in the pan.

3.Pour milk over the chicken until it reaches halfway up the bird. Season with salt and black pepper.

4.Roast in the oven for 1 hour 20 minutes, basting occasionally with milk and juices.

5.Remove chicken, let it rest for 10 minutes, then carve. Serve with sauce and roasted vegetables.
http://localhost:5037/sections/c1b1274f-165f-4efb-a04a-507d624fa9eb.jpeg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H8h0kbBFo2I

quizQuestions.question: What ingredient keeps the chicken moist in this recipe?
Which herb is used for flavoring?
How long should the chicken roast in the oven?
What is used for basting the chicken?

CourseSections.content: Spaghetti Pomodoro is all about simplicity and freshness. Jamie Oliver emphasizes using ripe cherry tomatoes, fresh basil, and high-quality olive oil to create a vibrant, quick pasta sauce. The dish highlights the beauty of Italian cooking: minimal ingredients, maximum flavor.

course.ingredients: spaghetti, cherry tomatoes, garlic, fresh basil, olive oil, Parmesan cheese, salt, black pepper
course.description: Jamie Oliver’s Spaghetti Pomodoro is a quick, classic Italian pasta dish. Fresh tomatoes, garlic, and basil create a simple yet flavorful sauce perfect for any weeknight dinner.

sections.content:
1.Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.

2.Heat olive oil in a pan. Sauté minced garlic until fragrant.

3.Add cherry tomatoes and cook until they soften and release juices. Season with salt and black pepper.

4.Drain spaghetti and add to the pan. Toss with fresh basil and grated Parmesan.

5.Serve hot with extra Parmesan and a drizzle of olive oil.
http://localhost:5037/sections/7343b181-05af-4608-8969-ce1ac11db875.webp
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lWaBh-r2ZP0

quizQuestions.question: Which ingredient adds freshness to Spaghetti Pomodoro?
What type of cheese is used in this recipe?
How long does it take to cook this dish?
Which step releases the flavor from garlic?

5.Serve hot with extra Parmesan and a drizzle of olive oil.

course.ingredients: spaghetti, cherry tomatoes, garlic, fresh basil, olive oil, Parmesan cheese, salt, black pepper
course.description: Jamie Oliver’s Spaghetti Pomodoro is a quick, classic Italian pasta dish. Fresh tomatoes, garlic, and basil create a simple yet flavorful sauce perfect for any weeknight dinner.

sections.content: Spaghetti Pomodoro is all about simplicity and freshness. Jamie Oliver emphasizes using ripe cherry tomatoes, fresh basil, and high-quality olive oil to create a vibrant, quick pasta sauce. The dish highlights the beauty of Italian cooking: minimal ingredients, maximum flavor.

1.Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.

2.Heat olive oil in a pan. Sauté minced garlic until fragrant.

3.Add cherry tomatoes and cook until they soften and release juices. Season with salt and black pepper.

4.Drain spaghetti and add to the pan. Toss with fresh basil and grated Parmesan.

5.Serve hot with extra Parmesan and a drizzle of olive oil.

CourseSections.content: Seared sea bass is a hallmark of Ducasse’s refined cuisine. The fish is lightly seasoned and cooked to retain moisture, while fennel is braised with citrus to provide a fragrant, slightly sweet complement. White wine and butter enrich the sauce, and fresh herbs elevate the final presentation, demonstrating the French mastery of flavor and technique.

course.courseName: Seared Sea Bass with Fennel and Citrus
course.ingredients: sea bass fillets, fennel, oranges, lemons, olive oil, butter, salt, black pepper, fresh herbs (thyme, parsley), white wine
course.description: Alain Ducasse’s seared sea bass dish highlights delicate flavors with a combination of fresh citrus, tender fennel, and perfectly cooked fish. This elegant dish balances light, aromatic ingredients with precise cooking techniques.

Posts.title: Invitation to an exceptional gastronomic journey
Posts.content:
On November 13th and 14th, @lemeuricealainducasse restaurant will host a unique four-hand dinner, conceived by the Dom Pérignon Society chefs, @amaurybouhours and @qiqedacosta , alongside Maison @domperignonofficial .
Following an initial encounter in Spain, a unique sensory experience will come to life, highlighting the dialogue between haute French and Spanish cuisine around tactility, inspired by Dom Pérignon vintages.
A celebration of excellence and creativity. ✨

Enjoy responsibly

sections.content:
1.Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Clean and trim fennel; slice thinly.

2.Heat olive oil and butter in a pan. Add fennel and sauté for 3–4 minutes.

3.Add white wine, salt, and black pepper; simmer until fennel is tender.

4.Season sea bass fillets with salt and pepper. Sear skin-side down in hot oil until golden, then finish in oven for 5–7 minutes.

5.Slice oranges and lemons; add to fennel pan briefly to warm.

6.Plate fennel with citrus slices, place seared sea bass on top, drizzle pan sauce, and garnish with fresh herbs.
http://localhost:5037/sections/19e88439-b8da-4dca-991d-0eef6cb5587c.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eJFfHu9NZdY

quizQuestions.question: What is the key vegetable used in this dish?
Which citrus fruits are used?
What is critical for perfect seared sea bass?
Which ingredient enriches the sauce?

CourseSections.content: Chocolate fondant is a classic French dessert popularized by Alain Ducasse for its perfect molten center. Precision in baking time and ingredient ratios ensures a gooey core with a firm outer layer. Paired with a silky caramel sauce, this dessert balances bitterness from dark chocolate with sweetness from caramel, offering a luxurious finish to any meal.

course.ingredients: dark chocolate, butter, sugar, eggs, flour, cream, caramel sugar, vanilla extract, salt
course.description: Alain Ducasse’s chocolate fondant is a decadent dessert with a molten center. Served with smooth caramel sauce, it combines rich chocolate flavor with a velvety texture, perfect for an impressive dessert course.

Posts.title: Invitation to an exceptional gastronomic journey
Posts.content:
On November 13th and 14th, @lemeuricealainducasse restaurant will host a unique four-hand dinner, conceived by the Dom Pérignon Society chefs, @amaurybouhours and @qiqedacosta , alongside Maison @domperignonofficial .
Following an initial encounter in Spain, a unique sensory experience will come to life, highlighting the dialogue between haute French and Spanish cuisine around tactility, inspired by Dom Pérignon vintages.
A celebration of excellence and creativity. ✨

Enjoy responsibly

sections.content:
1.Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Butter and flour small ramekins.

2.Melt dark chocolate and butter together over a double boiler.

3.Beat eggs with sugar until pale and fluffy. Fold in chocolate mixture carefully.

4.Sift in flour and gently fold until smooth.

5.Pour batter into prepared ramekins. Bake for 10–12 minutes until edges are set but center remains soft.

6.Prepare caramel sauce by melting sugar in a pan until golden, then add cream and a pinch of salt, stirring until smooth.

7.Serve fondants immediately, drizzled with caramel sauce.
http://localhost:5037/sections/8fe695ca-e192-430a-b405-104df061b770.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6B55jaBuwEU

quizQuestions.question: What type of chocolate is used in this fondant?
How long is the fondant baked?
What gives the dessert a molten center?
quizQuestions.option1: Baking at high temperature for short time
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: Baking at high temperature for short time

quizQuestions.question: What is added to the caramel sauce to balance sweetness?

CourseSections.content: Egg Fried Rice is a classic comfort food. Nigel Ng emphasizes using day-old rice for the best texture, ensuring the grains stay separate and fluffy. Quick stir-frying with eggs, garlic, and spring onions creates a balance of savory and aromatic flavors. Soy sauce and sesame oil finish the dish with depth and umami.

course.ingredients: cooked rice, eggs, garlic, spring onion, soy sauce, sesame oil, oil, salt, black pepper
course.description: Nigel Ng’s Egg Fried Rice is a simple yet flavorful dish combining fluffy eggs, aromatic garlic, and spring onions with perfectly cooked rice. This dish is quick, satisfying, and a staple in many Asian kitchens.

Posts.title: Three Knives Best Chef Award!
Posts.content:
Our warmest congratulations to @chef_julien on being awarded Three Knives once again by @thebestchefawards.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we’ve long admired from around the world.

As we take this time to refresh our space and experience, this honour is a timely reminder of why we do what we do—and it fills us with hope and inspiration for the season ahead.

sections.content:
1.Use day-old rice and break up any clumps.

2.Heat oil in a wok or pan over high heat. Sauté minced garlic until fragrant.

3.Push garlic to the side, crack eggs into the pan, and scramble until just set.

4.Add rice, toss to combine, breaking up clumps.

5.Add soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, and black pepper to taste.

6.Stir in chopped spring onions and cook for 1–2 minutes. Serve hot.
http://localhost:5037/sections/b9cce2ae-15ac-49d1-bbd2-9cf25afdf650.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SGBP3sG3a9Y

quizQuestions.question: Why is day-old rice preferred for fried rice?

When are the spring onions added?
What type of oil is commonly used?

sections.content: Egg Fried Rice is a classic comfort food. Nigel Ng emphasizes using day-old rice for the best texture, ensuring the grains stay separate and fluffy. Quick stir-frying with eggs, garlic, and spring onions creates a balance of savory and aromatic flavors. Soy sauce and sesame oil finish the dish with depth and umami.

1.Use day-old rice and break up any clumps.

2.Heat oil in a wok or pan over high heat. Sauté minced garlic until fragrant.

3.Push garlic to the side, crack eggs into the pan, and scramble until just set.

4.Add rice, toss to combine, breaking up clumps.

5.Add soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, and black pepper to taste.

6.Stir in chopped spring onions and cook for 1–2 minutes. Serve hot.
http://localhost:5037/sections/b9cce2ae-15ac-49d1-bbd2-9cf25afdf650.jpg

quizQuestions.question: Why is day-old rice preferred for fried rice?
Which ingredient adds umami flavor?
When are the spring onions added?
What type of oil is commonly used?

CourseSections.content: Pho is Vietnam’s national dish, and Nigel Ng’s version emphasizes a clear, flavorful broth. Slow-simmering beef bones with spices such as star anise, cinnamon, and cloves creates depth of flavor. Fresh herbs, lime, and chili are added at the table to personalize the soup. The combination of tender noodles, thinly sliced beef, and aromatic broth makes this dish iconic.

course.ingredients: beef bones, beef slices, rice noodles, onion, ginger, star anise, cloves, cinnamon stick, fish sauce, sugar, salt, cilantro, basil, lime, chili, bean sprouts
course.description: Nigel Ng’s Pho is a fragrant Vietnamese beef noodle soup with a rich, aromatic broth made from simmered bones and spices. Served with tender beef, fresh herbs, and lime, it’s a perfect combination of savory, sweet, and umami flavors.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we’ve long admired from around the world.

sections.content:
1.Roast beef bones in the oven for 30 minutes to develop flavor.

2.Char onion and ginger over an open flame or broil in the oven.

3.In a large pot, add bones, onion, ginger, star anise, cloves, cinnamon, and water. Simmer 3–4 hours.

4.Strain broth, season with fish sauce, sugar, and salt.

5.Cook rice noodles according to package instructions.

6.Arrange noodles and thin slices of raw beef in a bowl. Pour hot broth over to cook the beef.

7.Garnish with cilantro, basil, lime, chili, and bean sprouts. Serve immediately.

quizQuestions.option1: To remove bitterness and enhance flavor
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: To remove bitterness and enhance flavor

quizQuestions.question: How is the thin beef cooked in Pho?
quizQuestions.option3: Cooked by pouring hot broth over it
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: Cooked by pouring hot broth over it

CourseSections.content: This recipe highlights Pic’s mastery of flavors, combining the sweetness of lobster with a light yet rich champagne sauce. The shallots add depth, while cream and butter create a luxurious texture. Precision in cooking the lobster ensures it stays tender, and the sauce is balanced to enhance—not overpower—the seafood.

course.ingredients: lobster tails, shallots, champagne, heavy cream, butter, olive oil, salt, white pepper, chives, lemon juice
course.description: Anne-Sophie Pic’s lobster dish showcases delicate seafood with a luxurious champagne cream sauce. This elegant dish balances the natural sweetness of lobster with a silky, aromatic sauce, perfect for a fine dining experience.

Posts.title: Pinot Noir Grape
Posts.content:
Back in 2012, we hosted a wine event with the world-renowned vineyard Chateau d’Yquem, for which our chefs and sommelier collaborated to create a dish that captured the aroma and flavour profile of what noble rot—Botrytis Cinerea—develops in their legendary Sauternes. The complexity of the wine was matched by the complexity of the dish: the recipe has 55 stages in its preparation.

This year, we’re hosting another prestigious wine dinner, with the equally world-renowned vineyard, Domaine de la Romanée-Conti. In honour of their expression of the Pinot Noir grape, Heston and his development team, pastry chefs and sommeliers were busy creating a brand-new version of this epic dessert, this time inspired by the complex characteristics of Pinot Noir.

Pinot Noir Grape will be featured on our à la carte menu from 18th July.

sections.content:
1.Boil lobster tails for 5–6 minutes until just cooked. Remove meat and set aside.

2,Finely chop shallots and sauté in butter and olive oil until soft.

3.Deglaze pan with champagne and reduce by half.

4.Add heavy cream, salt, white pepper, and a squeeze of lemon juice. Simmer until sauce thickens.

5.Add lobster meat back to pan to warm gently.

6.Plate lobster and drizzle with champagne sauce. Garnish with finely chopped chives.
http://localhost:5037/sections/cbf62efc-6e42-4fbd-ac6a-c3f37be0e5c1.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lA4OQssT-Gc

quizQuestions.question: Which ingredient gives richness to the sauce?
How long should lobster be cooked?
Why is champagne added?
What herb is used for garnish?

CourseSections.content: Roasted quail with truffle jus is a refined dish emphasizing precision and balance. Quail is delicate, requiring careful roasting to retain moisture, while the truffle jus adds depth and an earthy aroma. Anne-Sophie Pic’s style combines meticulous technique with simplicity in ingredients, highlighting the natural flavors of each component.

course.ingredients: quail, black truffle, chicken stock, shallots, butter, olive oil, garlic, thyme, salt, black pepper
course.description: This elegant dish from Anne-Sophie Pic features tender roasted quail paired with a rich truffle jus. The combination of earthy truffle, aromatic herbs, and perfectly cooked game bird exemplifies haute French cuisine.

sections.content:
1.Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Clean quail and pat dry, season with salt and black pepper.

2.Heat olive oil and butter in a pan. Sear quail on all sides until golden brown.

3.Remove quail, sauté chopped shallots and garlic until fragrant.

4.Deglaze pan with chicken stock, add thyme, and simmer to reduce into a jus.

5.Shave or grate black truffle into the jus, stir gently.

6.Roast quail in the oven for 8–10 minutes until cooked through.

7.Plate quail and drizzle with truffle jus. Serve with seasonal vegetables or a light puree.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3ptxpMWJRd0

How long should quail be roasted after searing?

course.description: This elegant dish from Anne-Sophie Pic features tender roasted quail paired with a rich truffle jus. The combination of earthy truffle, aromatic herbs, and perfectly cooked game bird exemplifies haute French cuisine.

Posts.title: Pinot Noir Grape
Posts.content:
Back in 2012, we hosted a wine event with the world-renowned vineyard Chateau d’Yquem, for which our chefs and sommelier collaborated to create a dish that captured the aroma and flavour profile of what noble rot—Botrytis Cinerea—develops in their legendary Sauternes. The complexity of the wine was matched by the complexity of the dish: the recipe has 55 stages in its preparation.

This year, we’re hosting another prestigious wine dinner, with the equally world-renowned vineyard, Domaine de la Romanée-Conti. In honour of their expression of the Pinot Noir grape, Heston and his development team, pastry chefs and sommeliers were busy creating a brand-new version of this epic dessert, this time inspired by the complex characteristics of Pinot Noir.

Pinot Noir Grape will be featured on our à la carte menu from 18th July.

sections.content: Roasted quail with truffle jus is a refined dish emphasizing precision and balance. Quail is delicate, requiring careful roasting to retain moisture, while the truffle jus adds depth and an earthy aroma. Anne-Sophie Pic’s style combines meticulous technique with simplicity in ingredients, highlighting the natural flavors of each component.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

Posts.title: Three Knives Best Chef Award!
Posts.content:
Our warmest congratulations to @chef_julien on being awarded Three Knives once again by @thebestchefawards.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we’ve long admired from around the world.

As we take this time to refresh our space and experience, this honour is a timely reminder of why we do what we do—and it fills us with hope and inspiration for the season ahead.

sections.content: Beef Wellington is an iconic dish often served at festive occasions and high-end restaurants. The dish combines a perfectly seared beef tenderloin with a layer of savory mushroom duxelles and prosciutto, all encased in buttery puff pastry. Achieving the right cooking temperature is critical: the beef should be medium-rare, the mushrooms cooked down, and the pastry golden and crisp. Timing, preparation, and attention to detail make this dish a rewarding culinary experience.

1.Trim and season beef tenderloin with salt and black pepper. Sear on all sides in hot oil until browned. Brush with Dijon mustard and let cool.

2.Finely chop mushrooms, shallots, and garlic. Cook in butter with thyme until moisture evaporates, forming mushroom duxelles. Let cool.

3.Lay prosciutto slices on plastic wrap, spread mushroom duxelles on top, and place beef in the center. Wrap tightly and chill for 15–30 minutes.

4.Roll out puff pastry. Place beef and prosciutto-duxelles on the pastry and wrap completely, sealing edges. Brush with egg yolk.

5.Chill wrapped beef briefly to firm up the pastry. Score the top lightly for decoration.

6.Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (400°F) for 25–30 minutes or until pastry is golden and beef reaches medium-rare (about 54°C / 130°F).

7.Let rest 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with pan sauce or red wine jus.
http://localhost:5037/sections/d30a58b9-c440-42b1-a676-e1780e614177.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cyskqnp1j64

quizQuestions.question: What is the purpose of the mushroom duxelles?
quizQuestions.option4: Prevent the pastry from getting soggy
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: Prevent the pastry from getting soggy

quizQuestions.question: Which step is critical for achieving a medium-rare beef inside?
What is traditionally wrapped around the beef before puff pastry?

QuizQuestions.option4: Prevent the pastry from getting soggy
QuizQuestions.correctAnswer: Prevent the pastry from getting soggy

It’s a show-stopping centerpiece for special occasions and requires careful preparation to achieve the perfect balance of juicy beef and golden pastry.

sections.content: Beef Wellington is an iconic dish often served at festive occasions and high-end restaurants. The dish combines a perfectly seared beef tenderloin with a layer of savory mushroom duxelles and prosciutto, all encased in buttery puff pastry. Achieving the right cooking temperature is critical: the beef should be medium-rare, the mushrooms cooked down, and the pastry golden and crisp. Timing, preparation, and attention to detail make this dish a rewarding culinary experience.

1.Trim and season beef tenderloin with salt and black pepper. Sear on all sides in hot oil until browned. Brush with Dijon mustard and let cool.

2.Finely chop mushrooms, shallots, and garlic. Cook in butter with thyme until moisture evaporates, forming mushroom duxelles. Let cool.

3.Lay prosciutto slices on plastic wrap, spread mushroom duxelles on top, and place beef in the center. Wrap tightly and chill for 15–30 minutes.

4.Roll out puff pastry. Place beef and prosciutto-duxelles on the pastry and wrap completely, sealing edges. Brush with egg yolk.

5.Chill wrapped beef briefly to firm up the pastry. Score the top lightly for decoration.

6.Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (400°F) for 25–30 minutes or until pastry is golden and beef reaches medium-rare (about 54°C / 130°F).

7.Let rest 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with pan sauce or red wine jus.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cyskqnp1j64

course.description: Beef Wellington is a classic British dish featuring a tender beef fillet coated with mushroom duxelles and wrapped in crispy puff pastry. It’s a show-stopping centerpiece for special occasions and requires careful preparation to achieve the perfect balance of juicy beef and golden pastry.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

Our warmest congratulations to @chef_julien on being awarded Three Knives once again by @thebestchefawards.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we’ve long admired from around the world.

As we take this time to refresh our space and experience, this honour is a timely reminder of why we do what we do—and it fills us with hope and inspiration for the season ahead.

sections.content: Beef Wellington is an iconic dish often served at festive occasions and high-end restaurants. The dish combines a perfectly seared beef tenderloin with a layer of savory mushroom duxelles and prosciutto, all encased in buttery puff pastry. Achieving the right cooking temperature is critical: the beef should be medium-rare, the mushrooms cooked down, and the pastry golden and crisp. Timing, preparation, and attention to detail make this dish a rewarding culinary experience.

1.Trim and season beef tenderloin with salt and black pepper. Sear on all sides in hot oil until browned. Brush with Dijon mustard and let cool.

2.Finely chop mushrooms, shallots, and garlic. Cook in butter with thyme until moisture evaporates, forming mushroom duxelles. Let cool.

3.Lay prosciutto slices on plastic wrap, spread mushroom duxelles on top, and place beef in the center. Wrap tightly and chill for 15–30 minutes.

4.Roll out puff pastry. Place beef and prosciutto-duxelles on the pastry and wrap completely, sealing edges. Brush with egg yolk.

5.Chill wrapped beef briefly to firm up the pastry. Score the top lightly for decoration.

6.Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (400°F) for 25–30 minutes or until pastry is golden and beef reaches medium-rare (about 54°C / 130°F).

7.Let rest 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with pan sauce or red wine jus.
http://localhost:5037/sections/d30a58b9-c440-42b1-a676-e1780e614177.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cyskqnp1j64

QuizQuestions.question: What ingredient keeps the chicken moist in this recipe?

course.ingredients: whole chicken, milk, butter, garlic, lemon, fresh sage, salt, black pepper
course.description: Jamie Oliver’s Chicken in Milk is a comforting roast chicken recipe that stays tender and juicy. The milk, butter, garlic, and lemon infuse the chicken with subtle flavors while creating a delicious sauce.

sections.content: This classic Jamie Oliver recipe involves roasting a whole chicken in milk with aromatics like garlic, lemon, and sage. The milk keeps the chicken moist while the lemon and garlic give a gentle tangy and savory flavor. Perfect for family dinners or special occasions.

1.Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Pat the chicken dry. Slice lemon and peel garlic cloves.

2.Melt butter in a roasting pan. Add garlic, lemon slices, and sage. Place the chicken in the pan.

3.Pour milk over the chicken until it reaches halfway up the bird. Season with salt and black pepper.

4.Roast in the oven for 1 hour 20 minutes, basting occasionally with milk and juices.

5.Remove chicken, let it rest for 10 minutes, then carve. Serve with sauce and roasted vegetables.
http://localhost:5037/sections/c1b1274f-165f-4efb-a04a-507d624fa9eb.jpeg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H8h0kbBFo2I

QuizQuestions.question: Which ingredient adds freshness to Spaghetti Pomodoro?

course.ingredients: spaghetti, cherry tomatoes, garlic, fresh basil, olive oil, Parmesan cheese, salt, black pepper
course.description: Jamie Oliver’s Spaghetti Pomodoro is a quick, classic Italian pasta dish. Fresh tomatoes, garlic, and basil create a simple yet flavorful sauce perfect for any weeknight dinner.

sections.content: Spaghetti Pomodoro is all about simplicity and freshness. Jamie Oliver emphasizes using ripe cherry tomatoes, fresh basil, and high-quality olive oil to create a vibrant, quick pasta sauce. The dish highlights the beauty of Italian cooking: minimal ingredients, maximum flavor.

1.Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.

2.Heat olive oil in a pan. Sauté minced garlic until fragrant.

3.Add cherry tomatoes and cook until they soften and release juices. Season with salt and black pepper.

4.Drain spaghetti and add to the pan. Toss with fresh basil and grated Parmesan.

5.Serve hot with extra Parmesan and a drizzle of olive oil.
http://localhost:5037/sections/7343b181-05af-4608-8969-ce1ac11db875.webp
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lWaBh-r2ZP0

course.courseName: Seared Sea Bass with Fennel and Citrus
course.ingredients: sea bass fillets, fennel, oranges, lemons, olive oil, butter, salt, black pepper, fresh herbs (thyme, parsley), white wine
course.description: Alain Ducasse’s seared sea bass dish highlights delicate flavors with a combination of fresh citrus, tender fennel, and perfectly cooked fish. This elegant dish balances light, aromatic ingredients with precise cooking techniques.

Posts.title: Invitation to an exceptional gastronomic journey
Posts.content:
On November 13th and 14th, @lemeuricealainducasse restaurant will host a unique four-hand dinner, conceived by the Dom Pérignon Society chefs, @amaurybouhours and @qiqedacosta , alongside Maison @domperignonofficial .
Following an initial encounter in Spain, a unique sensory experience will come to life, highlighting the dialogue between haute French and Spanish cuisine around tactility, inspired by Dom Pérignon vintages.
A celebration of excellence and creativity. ✨

Enjoy responsibly

sections.content: Seared sea bass is a hallmark of Ducasse’s refined cuisine. The fish is lightly seasoned and cooked to retain moisture, while fennel is braised with citrus to provide a fragrant, slightly sweet complement. White wine and butter enrich the sauce, and fresh herbs elevate the final presentation, demonstrating the French mastery of flavor and technique.

1.Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Clean and trim fennel; slice thinly.

2.Heat olive oil and butter in a pan. Add fennel and sauté for 3–4 minutes.

3.Add white wine, salt, and black pepper; simmer until fennel is tender.

4.Season sea bass fillets with salt and pepper. Sear skin-side down in hot oil until golden, then finish in oven for 5–7 minutes.

5.Slice oranges and lemons; add to fennel pan briefly to warm.

6.Plate fennel with citrus slices, place seared sea bass on top, drizzle pan sauce, and garnish with fresh herbs.
http://localhost:5037/sections/19e88439-b8da-4dca-991d-0eef6cb5587c.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eJFfHu9NZdY

quizQuestions.question: Which citrus fruits are used?

Which ingredient enriches the sauce?

sections.content: Chocolate fondant is a classic French dessert popularized by Alain Ducasse for its perfect molten center. Precision in baking time and ingredient ratios ensures a gooey core with a firm outer layer. Paired with a silky caramel sauce, this dessert balances bitterness from dark chocolate with sweetness from caramel, offering a luxurious finish to any meal.

1.Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Butter and flour small ramekins.

2.Melt dark chocolate and butter together over a double boiler.

3.Beat eggs with sugar until pale and fluffy. Fold in chocolate mixture carefully.

4.Sift in flour and gently fold until smooth.

5.Pour batter into prepared ramekins. Bake for 10–12 minutes until edges are set but center remains soft.

6.Prepare caramel sauce by melting sugar in a pan until golden, then add cream and a pinch of salt, stirring until smooth.

7.Serve fondants immediately, drizzled with caramel sauce.
http://localhost:5037/sections/8fe695ca-e192-430a-b405-104df061b770.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6B55jaBuwEU

quizQuestions.question: How long is the fondant baked?
What gives the dessert a molten center?
quizQuestions.option1: Baking at high temperature for short time
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: Baking at high temperature for short time

On November 13th and 14th, @lemeuricealainducasse restaurant will host a unique four-hand dinner, conceived by the Dom Pérignon Society chefs, @amaurybouhours and @qiqedacosta , alongside Maison @domperignonofficial .
Following an initial encounter in Spain, a unique sensory experience will come to life, highlighting the dialogue between haute French and Spanish cuisine around tactility, inspired by Dom Pérignon vintages.
A celebration of excellence and creativity. ✨

Enjoy responsibly

sections.content: Chocolate fondant is a classic French dessert popularized by Alain Ducasse for its perfect molten center. Precision in baking time and ingredient ratios ensures a gooey core with a firm outer layer. Paired with a silky caramel sauce, this dessert balances bitterness from dark chocolate with sweetness from caramel, offering a luxurious finish to any meal.

1.Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Butter and flour small ramekins.

2.Melt dark chocolate and butter together over a double boiler.

3.Beat eggs with sugar until pale and fluffy. Fold in chocolate mixture carefully.

4.Sift in flour and gently fold until smooth.

5.Pour batter into prepared ramekins. Bake for 10–12 minutes until edges are set but center remains soft.

6.Prepare caramel sauce by melting sugar in a pan until golden, then add cream and a pinch of salt, stirring until smooth.

7.Serve fondants immediately, drizzled with caramel sauce.
http://localhost:5037/sections/8fe695ca-e192-430a-b405-104df061b770.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6B55jaBuwEU

quizQuestions.question: What type of chocolate is used in this fondant?
How long is the fondant baked?
What is added to the caramel sauce to balance sweetness?

QuizQuestions.question: What is added to the caramel sauce to balance sweetness?

course.ingredients: dark chocolate, butter, sugar, eggs, flour, cream, caramel sugar, vanilla extract, salt
course.description: Alain Ducasse’s chocolate fondant is a decadent dessert with a molten center. Served with smooth caramel sauce, it combines rich chocolate flavor with a velvety texture, perfect for an impressive dessert course.

Posts.title: Three Knives Best Chef Award!
Posts.content:
Our warmest congratulations to @chef_julien on being awarded Three Knives once again by @thebestchefawards.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we’ve long admired from around the world.

As we take this time to refresh our space and experience, this honour is a timely reminder of why we do what we do—and it fills us with hope and inspiration for the season ahead.

sections.content: Egg Fried Rice is a classic comfort food. Nigel Ng emphasizes using day-old rice for the best texture, ensuring the grains stay separate and fluffy. Quick stir-frying with eggs, garlic, and spring onions creates a balance of savory and aromatic flavors. Soy sauce and sesame oil finish the dish with depth and umami.

1.Use day-old rice and break up any clumps.

2.Heat oil in a wok or pan over high heat. Sauté minced garlic until fragrant.

3.Push garlic to the side, crack eggs into the pan, and scramble until just set.

4.Add rice, toss to combine, breaking up clumps.

5.Add soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, and black pepper to taste.

6.Stir in chopped spring onions and cook for 1–2 minutes. Serve hot.
http://localhost:5037/sections/b9cce2ae-15ac-49d1-bbd2-9cf25afdf650.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SGBP3sG3a9Y

sections.content: Pho is Vietnam’s national dish, and Nigel Ng’s version emphasizes a clear, flavorful broth. Slow-simmering beef bones with spices such as star anise, cinnamon, and cloves creates depth of flavor. Fresh herbs, lime, and chili are added at the table to personalize the soup. The combination of tender noodles, thinly sliced beef, and aromatic broth makes this dish iconic.

1.Roast beef bones in the oven for 30 minutes to develop flavor.

2.Char onion and ginger over an open flame or broil in the oven.

3.In a large pot, add bones, onion, ginger, star anise, cloves, cinnamon, and water. Simmer 3–4 hours.

4.Strain broth, season with fish sauce, sugar, and salt.

5.Cook rice noodles according to package instructions.

6.Arrange noodles and thin slices of raw beef in a bowl. Pour hot broth over to cook the beef.

7.Garnish with cilantro, basil, lime, chili, and bean sprouts. Serve immediately.
http://localhost:5037/sections/4cd574df-30c9-4ce4-be3d-0bad877d46f4.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z8f15a5IpBk

quizQuestions.question: Which spice is NOT typically used in Pho?
Why are onions and ginger charred?
quizQuestions.option1: To remove bitterness and enhance flavor
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: To remove bitterness and enhance flavor

quizQuestions.question: How is the thin beef cooked in Pho?
quizQuestions.option3: Cooked by pouring hot broth over it
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: Cooked by pouring hot broth over it

QuizQuestions.question: Which spice is NOT typically used in Pho?

Posts.title: Three Knives Best Chef Award!
Posts.content:
Our warmest congratulations to @chef_julien on being awarded Three Knives once again by @thebestchefawards.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we’ve long admired from around the world.

As we take this time to refresh our space and experience, this honour is a timely reminder of why we do what we do—and it fills us with hope and inspiration for the season ahead.

sections.content: Pho is Vietnam’s national dish, and Nigel Ng’s version emphasizes a clear, flavorful broth. Slow-simmering beef bones with spices such as star anise, cinnamon, and cloves creates depth of flavor. Fresh herbs, lime, and chili are added at the table to personalize the soup. The combination of tender noodles, thinly sliced beef, and aromatic broth makes this dish iconic.

1.Roast beef bones in the oven for 30 minutes to develop flavor.

2.Char onion and ginger over an open flame or broil in the oven.

3.In a large pot, add bones, onion, ginger, star anise, cloves, cinnamon, and water. Simmer 3–4 hours.

4.Strain broth, season with fish sauce, sugar, and salt.

5.Cook rice noodles according to package instructions.

6.Arrange noodles and thin slices of raw beef in a bowl. Pour hot broth over to cook the beef.

7.Garnish with cilantro, basil, lime, chili, and bean sprouts. Serve immediately.
http://localhost:5037/sections/4cd574df-30c9-4ce4-be3d-0bad877d46f4.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z8f15a5IpBk
