course.description: Anne-Sophie Pic’s lobster dish showcases delicate seafood with a luxurious champagne cream sauce. This elegant dish balances the natural sweetness of lobster with a silky, aromatic sauce, perfect for a fine dining experience.

Posts.title: Pinot Noir Grape
Posts.content:
Back in 2012, we hosted a wine event with the world-renowned vineyard Chateau d’Yquem, for which our chefs and sommelier collaborated to create a dish that captured the aroma and flavour profile of what noble rot—Botrytis Cinerea—develops in their legendary Sauternes. The complexity of the wine was matched by the complexity of the dish: the recipe has 55 stages in its preparation.

This year, we’re hosting another prestigious wine dinner, with the equally world-renowned vineyard, Domaine de la Romanée-Conti. In honour of their expression of the Pinot Noir grape, Heston and his development team, pastry chefs and sommeliers were busy creating a brand-new version of this epic dessert, this time inspired by the complex characteristics of Pinot Noir.

Pinot Noir Grape will be featured on our à la carte menu from 18th July.

sections.content: This recipe highlights Pic’s mastery of flavors, combining the sweetness of lobster with a light yet rich champagne sauce. The shallots add depth, while cream and butter create a luxurious texture. Precision in cooking the lobster ensures it stays tender, and the sauce is balanced to enhance—not overpower—the seafood.

1.Boil lobster tails for 5–6 minutes until just cooked. Remove meat and set aside.

2,Finely chop shallots and sauté in butter and olive oil until soft.

3.Deglaze pan with champagne and reduce by half.

4.Add heavy cream, salt, white pepper, and a squeeze of lemon juice. Simmer until sauce thickens.

5.Add lobster meat back to pan to warm gently.

6.Plate lobster and drizzle with champagne sauce. Garnish with finely chopped chives.
http://localhost:5037/sections/cbf62efc-6e42-4fbd-ac6a-c3f37be0e5c1.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lA4OQssT-Gc

sections.content: Roasted quail with truffle jus is a refined dish emphasizing precision and balance. Quail is delicate, requiring careful roasting to retain moisture, while the truffle jus adds depth and an earthy aroma. Anne-Sophie Pic’s style combines meticulous technique with simplicity in ingredients, highlighting the natural flavors of each component.

1.Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Clean quail and pat dry, season with salt and black pepper.

2.Heat olive oil and butter in a pan. Sear quail on all sides until golden brown.

3.Remove quail, sauté chopped shallots and garlic until fragrant.

4.Deglaze pan with chicken stock, add thyme, and simmer to reduce into a jus.

5.Shave or grate black truffle into the jus, stir gently.

6.Roast quail in the oven for 8–10 minutes until cooked through.

7.Plate quail and drizzle with truffle jus. Serve with seasonal vegetables or a light puree.
http://localhost:5037/sections/b5d7af01-f714-4452-90e0-6f2830e242c6.jpg
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3ptxpMWJRd0

Recipes.ingredients: Beef,Olive oil,mushrooms,thyme,puff pastry,ham,egg yolks,water,Sea salt,black pepper
Recipes.steps:
Wrap each piece of beef tightly in a triple layer of cling film to set its shape, then chill overnight.
Remove the cling film, then quickly sear the beef fillets in a hot pan with a little olive oil for 30-60 seconds until browned all over and rare in the middle. Remove from the pan and leave to cool.
Finely chop the mushrooms and fry in a hot pan with a little olive oil, the thyme leaves and some seasoning. When the mushrooms begin to release their juices, continue to cook over a high heat for about 10 minutes until all the excess moisture has evaporated and you are left with a mushroom paste (known as a duxelle). Remove the duxelle from the pan and leave to cool.
Cut the pastry in half, place on a lightly floured surface and roll each piece into a rectangle large enough to envelop one of the beef fillets. Chill in the refrigerator.
Lay a large sheet of cling film on a work surface and place 4 slices of Parma ham in the middle, overlapping them slightly, to create a square. Spread half the duxelle evenly over the ham.
Season the beef fillets, then place them on top of the mushroom-covered ham. Using the cling film, roll the Parma ham over the beef, then roll and tie the cling film to get a nice, evenly thick log. Repeat this step with the other beef fillet, then chill for at least 30 minutes.
Brush the pastry with the egg wash. Remove the cling film from the beef, then wrap the pastry around each ham-wrapped fillet. Trim the pastry and brush all over with the egg wash. Cover with cling film and chill for at least 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, make the red wine sauce. Heat the oil in a large pan, then fry the beef trimmings for a few minutes until browned on all sides. Stir in the shallots with the peppercorns, bay and thyme and continue to cook for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until the shallots turn golden brown.
Pour in the vinegar and let it bubble for a few minutes until almost dry. Now add the wine and boil until almost completely reduced. Add the stock and bring to the boil again. Lower the heat and simmer gently for 1 hour, removing any scum from the surface of the sauce, until you have the desired consistency. Strain the liquid through a fine sieve lined with muslin. Check for seasoning and set aside.
When you are ready to cook the beef wellingtons, score the pastry lightly and brush with the egg wash again, then bake at 200°C/Gas 6 for 15-20 minutes until the pastry is golden brown and cooked. Rest for 10 minutes before carving.
Meanwhile, reheat the sauce. Serve the beef wellingtons sliced, with the sauce as an accompaniment.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

Retour en images sur mon samedi au marché du Cours Saleya avec mon chef @emmanuel_pilon du @lelouisxvmonaco.

Recipes.ingredients: onions,lat-leaf parsley,olive oil,fennel seeds,dried chilli flakes,chopped tomatoes,lemon,sardines,extra virgin olive oil,dried spaghetti
Recipes.steps:
In a microwave-safe heatproof bowl, heat wine until steaming (alternatively, heat wine on the stovetop in a small saucepan). Add raisins and saffron, if using. Set aside.
Collage of raisins soaking in hot wine with saffron. the raisins are plumped and the liquid is golden-yellow.
In a small skillet, heat 1 1/2 tablespoons (22ml) olive oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add ground fennel and cook until fragrant, about 20 seconds. Add bread crumbs and cook, tossing, until lightly toasted. Transfer breadcrumbs to a bowl and season well with salt and pepper. Set aside.
A side by side collage of two photos, drizzling olive oil over breadcrumbs and then tossing toasted breadcrumbs in a skillet.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Mince half the fennel fronds and reserve the other half (uncut).
In a large skillet or sauté pan, heat remaining 3 tablespoons (45ml) olive oil over medium heat until shimmering. Add diced onion and diced fennel bulb and cook, stirring, until onion and fennel are soft and tender, about 8 minutes. Add anchovy fillets and cook, stirring, until dissolved in the oil.
Collage of anchovies cooking down in pan with chopped fennel.
Add wine, raisins, and saffron, and cook, scraping up any browned bits from bottom of pan, until wine is almost entirely evaporated.
A 4-image collage of pasta con sarde ingredients being added to pan: soaked raisin and saffron, toasted pine nuts, sardine, and then tossing all ingredients to combine.
Add pine nuts and sardines and cook, stirring, until sardines are just barely cooked through, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Meanwhile, cook the pasta until al dente, then drain, reserving at least 1 cup pasta cooking water.
Transfer pasta to skillet along with 1/4 cup pasta cooking water. Return skillet to medium-high heat and cook, stirring and tossing, until pasta is well-coated in sauce and any excess liquid has cooked off. Drizzle on some fresh olive oil (don't be shy) along with the minced fennel fronds, and toss well. Season with salt. Add a very small handful of bread crumbs and toss once more.
If at any point the pasta becomes too dry, add additional pasta cooking water in 1/4-cup increments, and toss to loosen and moisten (you can also drizzle on more olive oil as desired). The noodles should be slick and glossy with a sheen of sauce, but not sitting in a watery puddle.
Divide pasta into serving bowls, making sure to distribute sardines, pine nuts, and raisins evenly. Top with a more generous handful of breadcrumbs. Garnish with whole fennel fronds and serve right away.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

Recipes.ingredients: bone-in chicken pieces,water,large carrot,medium tomato,medium onion,crushed black peppercorns,medium potatoes,salt
Recipes.steps:
Gather the ingredients.
Ingredients for Malaysia ABC soup gathered
Put 1 pound bone-in chicken pieces in a medium saucepan with just enough water to cover. Cover and bring to a boil.
Chicken pieces boiling in a pot of water
Drain the water. Rinse the chicken under water to get rid of any impurities.
Boiled chicken rinsed in a colander
Fill a double boiler or a medium soup pot with 4 cups of water. Add the prepared chicken, cover, and boil over medium heat.
Chicken in a pot of water
Once the water boils, remove any impurities from the surface with a ladle. Adjust the heat to low.
Removing impurities with a ladle from the boiling chicken
Add 1 large carrot (peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces), 1 medium tomato (quartered), 1 medium onion (thinly sliced), and 1 teaspoon crushed black peppercorns. Simmer on very low heat for 1 1/2 hours.
Carrots, tomato, onion, and peppers added to the pot with the chicken
Peel 3 medium potatoes and cut into 1-inch cubes. Add to the soup. Continue to simmer until the chicken is cooked and the carrots and potatoes are tender, and still holding their shape, another 2 1/2 hours.
Potatoes in a pot with water, chicken, and vegetables
Add salt, to taste, and serve.

Posts.title: Three Knives Best Chef Award!
Posts.content:
Our warmest congratulations to @chef_julien on being awarded Three Knives once again by @thebestchefawards.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we’ve long admired from around the world.

As we take this time to refresh our space and experience, this honour is a timely reminder of why we do what we do—and it fills us with hope and inspiration for the season ahead.

Recipes.ingredients: House Vermont Curry,Cooked rice,Onion,Potato,Carrot,Chicken Cutlet
Recipes.steps:
Put oil into a pot and sauté onion pieces until the edges start browning
Add potato and carrot pieces to the pot and stir.
Add water and bring it to a boil. Remove scum as it rises.
Add curry roux and cook.
Cook chicken cutlets and slice them.
Put cooked rice on one side of a serving plate, place cutlet pieces next to the rice.
Pour curry on the side next to the cutlet away from the rice.
Place a small amount of fukujinzuke on the plate.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

Posts.title: Supermarket
Posts.content:
Retour en images sur mon samedi au marché du Cours Saleya avec mon chef @emmanuel_pilon du @lelouisxvmonaco.

Coup de cœur pour les amandes et la pâte de figue de Loulou, la roquette de Pierre, les tomates des sœurs Risso et bien évidemment le miel de Boris Lerebours.

Recipes.ingredients: jasmine rice,coconut milk,pandan leaves,fresh peeled ginger,salt,Sambal,Fried ikan bilis,hard-boiled eggs,Fried peanuts,Sliced cucumbers,banana leaf
Recipes.steps:
Set up a tiered steamer (see notes), filling the bottom section with about 3 inches of water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Line the steamer tier with cheesecloth.
Meanwhile, place the rice in a strainer and rinse the grains under running water until the water is almost clear. Drain rice, then transfer to a 10-inch nonstick skillet and add the coconut milk, 7 ounces (200ml) water, pandan leaves, ginger, and salt. Cook on medium heat, stirring continuously, until it thickens like rice pudding, 8-10 minutes.
Transfer the rice mixture to the cheesecloth-lined steamer tier and spread it in a roughly even layer. Set steamer tier over bottom section of boiling water, cover, and steam over medium heat until the grains are fully cooked, about 45 minutes; start checking rice doneness after 35 minutes of steaming. Once the rice reaches your preferred texture, turn off the heat and leave it to continue steaming, covered, until the steaming stops. The rice should be just cooked, with separate grains and a rich flavor of coconut.
Serve with sambal tumis and other nasi lemak accompaniments, depending on your preference (note that it's typical to leave the pandan leaves in the nasi lemak, as it's understood they will be removed at the table by the diner; do not eat them). If desired, nasi lemak can be served on a banana leaf, which will contribute its own fragrance to the dish as the rice and toppings are eaten.

Recipes.steps:
Place the ground beef in a skillet with olive oil.
Brown the beef with olive oil and then drain any fat.
Add the spices along with the tomato paste and water (or tomato sauce)
Bring the mixture to a simmer and then cook for a few more minutes until the sauce thickens.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

Recipes.ingredients: All purpose flour,Salt Hot water,Room temperature water,Oil,Butter,Ghee
Recipes.steps:
Divide the dough into 8 equal portions. Roll each portion into a smooth dough ball. Pour a little oil into a small bowl, and roll each dough ball in the oil to coat well. Make sure the dough balls aren’t touching each other if possible, to prevent them from sticking together. It IS okay even if they do stick each other, it’s just easier to handle if they don’t.
Place the oil coated dough balls on a plate. You can also add a very thin layer of oil onto the plate. Cover the plate with plastic wrap and let it rest for at least 1 hour. I usually make this about 8 – 10 hours ahead of time.
Once rested, place a ball of dough on a clean, smooth, flat surface. Apply a little bit of oil on your working surface. Use your palm to flatten out the dough ball. It should flatten out very easily. Then gently stretch the dough. I prefer to use my hands to do this, but you can also use a rolling pin.
I grab the edge of the dough and gently stretch it out, all the way around. The dough can be stretched out paper-thin without tearing (like with the window pane test). It can be a circle or square in shape.

Recipes.ingredients: Rice Noodles,chicken breast,shrimp,crispy Tofu,veggies,Eggs,Garlic cloves,shallots
Recipes.steps:
Soak the rice noodles. Pour boiling water over the rice noodles let them soak until they are soft and pliable (about 5-6 minutes) but not overly soft; drain.
Whisk the Eggs. Whisk the eggs in a medium bowl with a pinch of salt. Set aside by the stove.
How to make Pad Thai Sauce. Whisk the pad thai sauce ingredients together in a small bowl- keeping in mind, there is a delicate balance between salty, sour and sweet, so if you alter one ingredient, you may need to adjust the others. Make sure the sugar completely dissolves.
Prep the Protein & Veggies. Chop the shallot and garlic finely and set aside. Slice chicken thinly across the grain (or peel and devein shrimp). If adding veggies, chop or slice them small, so they cook quickly in the wok.
Prep all your garnishes and have everything ready to go by the stove, keeping in mind the stir fry part will go quickly!
Stir Fry! Season the protein with salt and pepper, and stir fry in a carbon steel wok until just cooked through and set it aside. If adding veggies, stir-fry these now and set aside as well.
Add more oil to the wok and stir fry the garlic and shallots for just a couple minutes, scoot them over, add more oil if needed, and add the whisked the eggs, scrambling and breaking to bits.
Add eggs and scramble
stir fry the rice noodles. Add the noodles and fry
Scoot the eggs over and add more oil and stir fry the noodles, letting the noodles get a little crispy! Turn your hood on and pour in the Pad Thai Sauce. Let the sauce caramelize for 30 seconds, until you smell the sugar caramelizing. This will add great flavor!
Add back in the cooked protein and veggies, with some of the bean sprouts and scallions. Add a squeeze of lime.
Serve. Divide between 2-3 bowls and garnish with fresh bean sprouts, lime, wedge, crushed peanuts, chili flakes, scallions and basil. For extra heat, serve it with our chili garlic sauce!

Posts.title: Supermarket
Posts.content:
Retour en images sur mon samedi au marché du Cours Saleya avec mon chef @emmanuel_pilon du @lelouisxvmonaco.

Coup de cœur pour les amandes et la pâte de figue de Loulou, la roquette de Pierre, les tomates des sœurs Risso et bien évidemment le miel de Boris Lerebours.

Recipes.ingredients: Butter,Flour,Yeast,Water,milk,Sugar,honey
Recipes.steps:
Mix the flour, sugar, and salt in a bowl. Add the yeast on the opposite side of the salt. Pour in the cold milk and add the softened butter. Knead until the dough becomes smooth and elastic. Shape it into a rectangle, wrap it, and chill in the refrigerator for at least one hour.
Place the cold butter between parchment paper and flatten it into a 15cm × 15cm square using a rolling pin. Chill until firm but flexible.
Roll the chilled dough into a 25cm × 25cm square. Place the butter block in the center at a diagonal angle. Fold the dough’s corners over the butter so it is fully sealed inside.
Roll the dough into a long rectangle. Fold it into three layers, like folding a letter. Wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Rotate the dough, roll it out again, and fold it into three layers once more. Chill for another 30 minutes.
Repeat the rolling and folding process one more time. Chill for 45 minutes.
Roll the dough into a large rectangle. Cut it into long triangles. Gently stretch each triangle, then roll it from the base toward the tip to form a croissant shape. Curve the ends slightly.
Place them on a baking tray and let them rise in a warm place until puffy and doubled in size. This usually takes 1 to 2 hours depending on room temperature.
Brush the croissants with egg wash. Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C for 15–18 minutes, or until deeply golden and flaky.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

Coup de cœur pour les amandes et la pâte de figue de Loulou, la roquette de Pierre, les tomates des sœurs Risso et bien évidemment le miel de Boris Lerebours.

Recipes.ingredients: chicken breast or thigh,olive oil,garlic,lemon juice,dried oregano,salt,black pepper,Greek yogurt,cucumber,garlic,lemon juice,olive oil,salt
Recipes.steps:
Mix olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Add the chicken pieces and coat them evenly. Let the chicken rest so it absorbs the flavors.
Combine Greek yogurt with grated and squeezed cucumber, minced garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, and a pinch of salt. Stir until smooth and chill in the fridge.
Thread the marinated chicken onto skewers and cook on a grill, pan, or air fryer until golden, slightly charred, and fully cooked.
Warm the pita bread and add the cooked chicken. Top with tzatziki, sliced tomato, onion, and lettuce for a complete Mediterranean plate.

Recipes.ingredients: cooked rice,spinach,carrot,cucumber,bean sprouts,shiitake mushrooms,egg,sesame oil,sesame seeds,gochujang,soy sauce,sugar,garlic,sesame oil
Recipes.steps:
Blanch the spinach and squeeze out excess water. Julienne the carrot and cucumber. Sauté the mushrooms lightly with a little sesame oil. Blanch or lightly sauté the bean sprouts. Season each vegetable with a small pinch of salt.
Mix gochujang with soy sauce, sugar, minced garlic, and sesame oil until smooth and slightly thick.
Fry an egg sunny-side up so the yolk stays runny.
Place warm rice in a bowl and arrange the spinach, carrot, cucumber, mushrooms, and bean sprouts on top. Add the fried egg in the center. Drizzle sesame oil, sprinkle sesame seeds, and serve with the gochujang sauce on the side or on top. Mix everything before eating.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

Recipes.ingredients: chicken,onion,ginger,cinnamon,cloves,fish sauce,salt,noodles,spring onion,cilantro,bean sprouts,lime,chili
Recipes.steps:
Lightly char the onion and ginger over a flame or in a dry pan. Add them to a pot with chicken, star anise, cinnamon, cloves, and water. Simmer gently until the chicken is cooked and the broth becomes fragrant and clear. Season with fish sauce and salt.
Cook the rice noodles until soft, then rinse briefly with cold water. Slice spring onion and cilantro. Rinse bean sprouts. Cut lime and chili.
Shred the cooked chicken. Place noodles into a bowl, top with chicken, spring onion, cilantro, and bean sprouts. Pour hot broth over everything. Add lime and chili to taste before eating.

Posts.title: Supermarket
Posts.content:
Retour en images sur mon samedi au marché du Cours Saleya avec mon chef @emmanuel_pilon du @lelouisxvmonaco.

Coup de cœur pour les amandes et la pâte de figue de Loulou, la roquette de Pierre, les tomates des sœurs Risso et bien évidemment le miel de Boris Lerebours.

Recipes.ingredients: spaghetti,garlic,olive oil,chili flakes,parsley,salt,black pepper,parmesan cheese,lemon
Recipes.steps:
Slice the garlic thinly. Chop the parsley. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil.
Cook the spaghetti until al dente. Reserve a small cup of pasta water before draining.
Heat olive oil in a pan and gently cook the garlic until lightly golden. Add chili flakes and a splash of pasta water to create a silky sauce.
Add the cooked spaghetti into the pan and toss well. Mix in parsley, season with salt and black pepper, and add a little more pasta water if needed.
Plate the pasta and finish with parmesan or a squeeze of lemon if you prefer. Serve warm.

Recipes.ingredients: cooked rice,egg,carrot,peas,spring onion,garlic,soy sauce,sesame oil,salt,black pepper,cooking oil
Recipes.steps:
Chop the carrot and spring onion. Mince the garlic. If using chicken or shrimp, cut into small pieces. Break the rice apart so there are no clumps.
Heat oil in a pan, scramble the egg until just set, then remove and keep aside.
Add a little more oil and sauté garlic until fragrant. Add carrot and peas and cook until slightly softened. Add chicken or shrimp if using and stir-fry until cooked.
Add the rice to the pan and stir-fry on high heat, breaking up any remaining clumps. Mix well with the vegetables.
Add soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, and black pepper. Return the scrambled egg and stir everything together. Sprinkle spring onion before serving.

Recipes.ingredients: chicken thigh,soy sauce,mirin,sugar,garlic,ginger,spring onion,sesame seeds,cooking oil
Recipes.steps:
Slice the chicken into large pieces. Mince the garlic and ginger. Chop the spring onion.
Mix soy sauce, mirin, and sugar in a bowl until the sugar dissolves. Add garlic and ginger.
Heat oil in a pan and place the chicken skin-side down (or smooth-side down). Cook until golden, then flip and cook the other side until done.
Pour the teriyaki sauce into the pan and let it simmer. The sauce will thicken into a glossy glaze that coats the chicken.
Slice the chicken, drizzle the extra glaze over it, and top with spring onion and sesame seeds. Serve with steamed rice or vegetables.

Recipes.ingredients: flat rice noodles,prawns,Chinese sausage,bean sprouts,chives,eggs,garlic,soy sauce,dark soy sauce,chili paste,fish sauce,oil
Recipes.steps:
Peel and devein the prawns. Slice the Chinese sausage. Chop the chives. Mince the garlic. Separate the eggs.
Heat oil in a wok, sauté garlic until fragrant. Add prawns and sausage, stir-fry until partially cooked.
Add the rice noodles, soy sauce, dark soy sauce, fish sauce, and chili paste. Toss everything together on high heat until the noodles are coated and heated through.
Push noodles aside and scramble the eggs in the wok. Mix eggs with noodles. Add bean sprouts and chives, toss briefly, then serve hot.

Recipes.ingredients: chicken breast,taco shells,onion,garlic,bell pepper,cumin,chili powder,paprika,salt,black pepper,olive oil,cilantro,lime,sour cream,shredded cheese,lettuce,tomato
Recipes.steps:
Slice the chicken into strips. Chop the onion, bell pepper, and tomato. Mince the garlic. Chop cilantro and shred the lettuce.
Heat olive oil in a pan, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant. Add chicken strips, sprinkle cumin, chili oking the Chickenpowder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook until chicken is fully cooked and slightly browned.
Warm the taco shells. Prepare shredded lettuce, diced tomato, cilantro, sour cream, and cheese for topping.
Place cooked chicken in each taco shell, top with lettuce, tomato, cheese, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime. Serve immediately.

Recipes.ingredients: chicken breast or thigh,yogurt,ginger,garlic,garam masala,turmeric,chili powder,cumin,coriander powder,salt,butter,tomato puree,cream,onion,kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves),oil,cilantro
Recipes.steps:
Mix yogurt, ginger, garlic, turmeric, chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Coat chicken pieces well and let them marinate for at least 1 hour.
Heat oil in a pan and sear the marinated chicken until partially cooked. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, melt butter and sauté finely chopped onion until golden. Add tomato puree, cumin, coriander powder, and more garam masala. Simmer until thickened.
Return the chicken to the pan and cook until fully done. Stir in cream and crush kasuri methi over the top. Adjust salt if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with naan or steamed rice

Recipes.ingredients: chicken breast or thigh,green curry paste,coconut milk,Thai eggplant,bell pepper,bamboo shoots,garlic,fish sauce,palm sugar,kaffir lime leaves,Thai basil,oil,jasmine rice
Recipes.steps:
Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Slice bell pepper and Thai eggplant. Mince garlic. Rinse jasmine rice.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté green curry paste with garlic until fragrant. Pour in half the coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add chicken and cook until partially done. Add Thai eggplant, bell pepper, and bamboo shoots. Pour in the remaining coconut milk.
Stir in fish sauce, palm sugar, and kaffir lime leaves. Simmer until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Remove from heat and stir in fresh Thai basil. Serve hot with steamed jasmine rice.

Recipes.ingredients: chicken pieces,red wine,bacon,mushrooms,onion,garlic,carrots,thyme,bay leaf,butter,flour,chicken stock,salt,black pepper,parsley,oil
Recipes.steps:
Cut chicken into serving pieces. Slice bacon, mushrooms, carrots, and onion. Mince garlic.
Heat oil in a pan and brown the chicken pieces on all sides. Remove and set aside. In the same pan, sauté bacon until crispy.
Add onions, carrots, and mushrooms to the pan and cook until slightly softened. Add garlic and cook briefly.
Sprinkle flour over the vegetables, stir, then pour in red wine and chicken stock. Add thyme and bay leaf. Bring to a simmer.
Return chicken to the pan, cover, and simmer gently until chicken is fully cooked and tender.
Adjust salt and pepper. Stir in butter for glossiness and sprinkle chopped parsley before serving. Serve hot with mashed potatoes or crusty bread.

Recipes.ingredients: ground beef,salt,black pepper,burger buns,cheddar cheese,lettuce,tomato,onion,pickles,ketchup,mustard,mayonnaise,butter,oil
Recipes.steps:
Form ground beef into burger patties and season with salt and black pepper. Slice tomato, onion, and pickles. Prepare lettuce leaves.
Heat oil in a pan or grill. Cook patties until browned on one side, then flip and cook to desired doneness. Place cheddar cheese on top to melt.
Spread butter on the burger buns and toast lightly until golden.
Place lettuce on the bottom bun, add the cooked patty with melted cheese, then tomato, onion, and pickles. Spread ketchup, mustard, and mayonnaise as desired. Top with the other bun and serve immediately.

Recipes.ingredients: cucumber,tomato,red onion,green bell pepper,Kalamata olives,feta cheese,olive oil,red wine vinegar,oregano,salt,black pepper
Recipes.steps:
Wash and chop cucumber, tomato, red onion, and bell pepper into bite-sized pieces.
Place chopped vegetables in a large bowl. Add Kalamata olives and chunks of feta cheese.
Drizzle olive oil and red wine vinegar over the salad. Sprinkle oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Toss gently to combine and serve fresh as a side or light main dish.

Recipes.ingredients: kimchi,pork belly or tofu,onion,garlic,green onion,gochugaru (Korean chili flakes),gochujang (Korean chili paste),soy sauce,sesame oil,water or broth,salt,sugar
Recipes.steps:
Slice pork belly or tofu into bite-sized pieces. Chop onion and green onion. Mince garlic. Cut kimchi into manageable pieces if needed.
Heat sesame oil in a pot, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant. Add pork belly and cook until slightly browned.
Add kimchi, gochugaru, gochujang, soy sauce, a pinch of sugar, and water or broth. Bring to a boil and then simmer for 15–20 minutes.
Add tofu if using and cook until heated through. Taste and adjust salt if needed. Sprinkle chopped green onion on top before serving. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Recipes.recipeName: Bún Bò Huế (Spicy Vietnamese Beef Noodle Soup)
Recipes.ingredients: beef shank,pork hock,lemongrass,shallots,garlic,shrimp paste,chili oil,fish sauce,rice vermicelli noodles,lime,bean sprouts,cilantro,green onion,salt,sugar,water
Recipes.steps:
Bruise lemongrass and char shallots and garlic slightly. In a large pot, boil beef shank and pork hock with water, lemongrass, charred shallots, and garlic until meat is tender.
Add fish sauce, shrimp paste, chili oil, salt, and a pinch of sugar. Simmer for additional flavor. Remove bones and slice meat thinly.
Cook rice vermicelli noodles according to package instructions. Rinse bean sprouts, chop green onion and cilantro, and cut lime into wedges.
Place noodles in bowls, add sliced beef and pork, pour hot broth over. Top with bean sprouts, cilantro, green onion, and a squeeze of lime. Serve immediately.

Recipes.ingredients: spaghetti or linguine,fresh basil leaves,garlic,pine nuts,Parmesan cheese,olive oil,salt,black pepper,cherry tomatoes
Recipes.steps:
Wash and dry basil leaves. Peel garlic. Grate Parmesan cheese. Toast pine nuts lightly if desired.
In a food processor or mortar and pestle, blend basil, garlic, pine nuts, and Parmesan. Slowly drizzle in olive oil while blending until smooth. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Boil pasta in salted water until al dente. Reserve a small cup of pasta water before draining.
Toss the cooked pasta with the pesto, adding reserved pasta water as needed to coat the noodles evenly.
Plate the pasta and optionally top with halved cherry tomatoes or extra Parmesan. Serve immediately.

Posts.title: Three Knives Best Chef Award!
Posts.content:
Our warmest congratulations to @chef_julien on being awarded Three Knives once again by @thebestchefawards.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we’ve long admired from around the world.

As we take this time to refresh our space and experience, this honour is a timely reminder of why we do what we do—and it fills us with hope and inspiration for the season ahead.

Recipes.ingredients: chicken breast or thigh,dried chili peppers,garlic,ginger,green onion,roasted peanuts,soy sauce,rice vinegar,hoisin sauce,sugar,cornstarch,sesame oil,cooking oil
Recipes.steps:
Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Mince garlic and ginger. Chop green onions. Mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, sugar, and cornstarch to make the sauce.
Heat oil in a wok, stir-fry chicken until lightly browned and cooked through. Remove and set aside.
Add more oil if needed. Stir-fry dried chili peppers, garlic, and ginger until fragrant.
Return chicken to the wok, pour in the sauce, and toss to coat evenly. Add roasted peanuts and green onions, stir briefly.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

Recipes.ingredients: pork loin or tenderloin,salt,black pepper,flour,egg,panko breadcrumbs,vegetable oil,cabbage,tonkatsu sauce,lemon wedges
Recipes.steps:
Season pork with salt and black pepper. Slice cabbage thinly. Prepare flour, beaten egg, and panko breadcrumbs in separate plates.
Coat each pork cutlet in flour, dip in beaten egg, and press into panko breadcrumbs until fully covered.
Heat oil in a frying pan. Fry the breaded pork until golden brown and cooked through. Drain on paper towels.
Slice the pork cutlets and serve with shredded cabbage, tonkatsu sauce, and a wedge of lemon. Serve hot.

Recipes.ingredients: beef,coconut milk,shallots,garlic,ginger,galangal,lemongrass,turmeric powder,chili,kaffir lime leaves,tamarind paste,salt,sugar,cooking oil
Recipes.steps:
Cut beef into cubes. Blend shallots, garlic, ginger, galangal, turmeric, and chili into a smooth paste. Bruise lemongrass stalks and prepare kaffir lime leaves.
Heat oil in a pot and sauté the blended spice paste until fragrant.
Add beef cubes and stir until coated with the paste. Pour in coconut milk, add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, tamarind paste, salt, and sugar.
Simmer on low heat, stirring occasionally, until beef is tender and sauce thickens into a rich, dark rendang.
Serve hot with steamed rice or ketupat.

Recipes.ingredients: chicken breast,corn tortillas,cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese,onion,garlic,bell pepper,enchilada sauce,cumin,chili powder,salt,black pepper,oil,cilantro,sour cream
Recipes.steps:
Cook and shred the chicken. Dice onion, garlic, and bell pepper. Grate cheese and chop cilantro.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté onion, garlic, and bell pepper until soft. Add shredded chicken, cumin, chili powder, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine.
Warm the tortillas slightly. Fill each with the chicken mixture and a little cheese, then roll them up. Place rolled tortillas in a baking dish.
Pour enchilada sauce over the tortillas and sprinkle remaining cheese on top. Bake in a preheated oven until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve with sour cream on the side.

Recipes.ingredients: canned chickpeas,onion,garlic,ginger,tomato,green chili,cumin seeds,coriander powder,turmeric,garam masala,chili powder,salt,oil,cilantro,lemon
Recipes.steps:
Chop onion, tomato, garlic, ginger, and green chili. Drain and rinse the chickpeas. Chop cilantro.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds until fragrant. Sauté onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili until golden.
Add coriander powder, turmeric, chili powder, and garam masala. Stir for a few seconds, then add chopped tomato and cook until soft.
Add chickpeas and a little water. Simmer until the chickpeas absorb the flavors and the curry thickens.
Adjust salt, sprinkle chopped cilantro, and add a squeeze of lemon before serving. Serve hot with rice or naan.

Recipes.ingredients: chicken breast or thigh,garlic,chili,onion,bell pepper,Thai basil leaves,soy sauce,fish sauce,oyster sauce,sugar,oil,steamed rice,fried egg (optional)
Recipes.steps:
Mince garlic and chili. Slice onion and bell pepper. Wash Thai basil leaves. Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Heat oil in a pan, sauté garlic and chili until fragrant. Add chicken and cook until mostly done.
Add onion and bell pepper, stir-fry briefly. Mix in soy sauce, fish sauce, oyster sauce, and a pinch of sugar. Stir well to coat everything.
Add Thai basil leaves and stir until wilted. Serve hot over steamed rice, optionally topped with a fried egg.

Recipes.ingredients: eggplant,zucchini,bell pepper,tomato,onion,garlic,olive oil,thyme,basil,salt,black pepper
Recipes.steps:
Slice eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper, and tomato into even pieces. Chop onion and mince garlic.
Heat olive oil in a large pan. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant. Add eggplant, zucchini, and bell pepper, cooking until slightly softened.
Add tomato slices, thyme, salt, and black pepper. Simmer until all vegetables are tender and flavors meld.
Sprinkle fresh basil over the top before serving. Serve warm as a side dish or with crusty bread.

Posts.title: Three Knives Best Chef Award!
Posts.content:
Our warmest congratulations to @chef_julien on being awarded Three Knives once again by @thebestchefawards.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we’ve long admired from around the world.

As we take this time to refresh our space and experience, this honour is a timely reminder of why we do what we do—and it fills us with hope and inspiration for the season ahead.

Recipes.ingredients: chicken wings,butter,hot sauce,garlic powder,paprika,salt,black pepper,celery sticks,ranch or blue cheese dressing,oil
Recipes.steps:
Pat chicken wings dry. Mix garlic powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper for seasoning. Prepare celery sticks and dressing for serving.
Heat oil in a deep pan or fryer. Fry the wings until golden brown and fully cooked. Drain excess oil.
Melt butter in a pan and mix with hot sauce to create the Buffalo sauce.
Toss the cooked wings in the Buffalo sauce until fully coated.
Serve hot with celery sticks and ranch or blue cheese dressing on the side.

Recipes.ingredients: eggs,tomato,onion,bell pepper,garlic,olive oil,cumin,paprika,chili flakes,salt,black pepper,parsley,feta cheese,bread
Recipes.steps:
Chop onion, bell pepper, garlic, and tomatoes. Chop parsley and crumble feta if using.
Heat olive oil in a pan, sauté onion and bell pepper until soft. Add garlic and spices (cumin, paprika, chili flakes) and cook briefly.
Add chopped tomatoes and simmer until sauce thickens. Season with salt and black pepper.
Make small wells in the sauce and crack eggs into each well. Cover and cook until eggs are set to your liking.
Sprinkle parsley and feta over the top. Serve hot with bread for dipping.

Recipes.ingredients: sweet potato noodles (dangmyeon),beef or chicken,spinach,carrot,onion,bell pepper,garlic,soy sauce,sugar,sesame oil,sesame seeds,cooking oil
Recipes.steps:
Cook sweet potato noodles according to package instructions and drain. Slice beef or chicken thinly. Julienne carrot and bell pepper. Chop onion and mince garlic. Blanch spinach and squeeze out excess water.
Heat oil in a pan, stir-fry meat until cooked. Remove and stir-fry carrot, bell pepper, and onion until slightly softened.
Add cooked noodles, meat, spinach, soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil to the pan. Toss everything together over medium heat until well combined.
Sprinkle sesame seeds on top and serve warm.

Recipes.ingredients: rice flour,coconut milk,turmeric powder,water,shrimp,pork belly,bean sprouts,green onion,lettuce,herbs (mint,cilantro,Thai basil),oil,fish sauce,sugar,lime,garlic,chili
Recipes.steps:
Slice pork and clean shrimp. Chop green onions and herbs. Mix rice flour, coconut milk, turmeric, and water to make a thin batter.
Heat oil in a pan. Pour a thin layer of batter to form a pancake. Add pork, shrimp, and a few bean sprouts on top. Cook until edges are crispy, then fold in half.
Mix fish sauce, sugar, lime juice, minced garlic, and chopped chili until balanced in flavor.
Serve hot with lettuce and fresh herbs for wrapping, alongside the dipping sauce.

Recipes.ingredients: lasagna noodles,ground beef,onion,garlic,tomato sauce,tomato paste,ricotta cheese,mozzarella cheese,Parmesan cheese,egg,olive oil,salt,black pepper,basil,oregano
Recipes.steps:
Chop onion and garlic. Mix ricotta cheese with egg, salt, and pepper. Grate mozzarella and Parmesan.
Heat olive oil in a pan, sauté onion and garlic until fragrant. Add ground beef and cook until browned. Stir in tomato sauce, tomato paste, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15–20 minutes.
Layer cooked noodles, meat sauce, and ricotta mixture in a baking dish. Sprinkle mozzarella and Parmesan between layers and on top. Repeat layers as needed.
Preheat oven and bake until cheese is melted and bubbly, and the top is golden brown.
Let it rest for a few minutes before slicing. Serve warm.

Posts.title: Invitation to an exceptional gastronomic journey
Posts.content:
On November 13th and 14th, @lemeuricealainducasse restaurant will host a unique four-hand dinner, conceived by the Dom Pérignon Society chefs, @amaurybouhours and @qiqedacosta , alongside Maison @domperignonofficial .
Following an initial encounter in Spain, a unique sensory experience will come to life, highlighting the dialogue between haute French and Spanish cuisine around tactility, inspired by Dom Pérignon vintages.
A celebration of excellence and creativity. ✨

Enjoy responsibly

Recipes.ingredients: pork tenderloin,bell pepper,pineapple,onion,garlic,ketchup,rice vinegar,sugar,soy sauce,cornstarch,egg,oil,salt,black pepper
Recipes.steps:
Cut pork into bite-sized pieces and season with salt and pepper. Dice bell pepper, onion, and pineapple. Mince garlic.
Coat pork pieces in cornstarch, then dip in beaten egg.
Heat oil in a pan and deep-fry or pan-fry pork until golden and crispy. Remove and drain excess oil.
In a separate pan, sauté garlic briefly. Add ketchup, rice vinegar, sugar, and soy sauce. Stir and simmer until slightly thickened.
Add cooked pork, bell pepper, onion, and pineapple into the sauce. Toss well to coat. Cook briefly until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

Recipes.ingredients: salmon fillets,soy sauce,mirin,sake,sugar,garlic,ginger,sesame seeds,green onion,oil,steamed rice,lemon wedges (optional)
Recipes.steps:
Pat salmon fillets dry. Mince garlic and ginger. Slice green onion and prepare lemon wedges if using.
Combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, sugar, garlic, and ginger in a small bowl.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Place salmon fillets skin-side down and cook until lightly browned, then flip and cook the other side.
Pour the teriyaki sauce over the salmon and simmer until it thickens and coats the fillets.
Sprinkle sesame seeds and green onion on top. Serve hot with steamed rice and lemon wedges.

Recipes.ingredients: rice noodles,chicken or prawns,coconut milk,laksa paste,lemongrass,galangal,garlic,onion,bean sprouts,fish sauce,lime,coriander,chili,oil,water
Recipes.steps:
Slice chicken or clean prawns. Chop onion, garlic, and coriander. Bruise lemongrass and galangal. Soak rice noodles according to package instructions.
Heat oil in a pot, sauté onion, garlic, lemongrass, and galangal until fragrant. Add laksa paste and fry briefly. Pour in water and coconut milk, bring to a simmer.
Add chicken or prawns to the simmering broth and cook until done.
Place cooked noodles in bowls. Add bean sprouts.
Pour hot broth and protein over the noodles. Garnish with coriander, sliced chili, and a squeeze of lime. Serve immediately.

Recipes.ingredients: chicken breast,bell peppers,onion,garlic,lime,chili powder,cumin,paprika,salt,black pepper,flour tortillas,oil,cilantro,sour cream,shredded cheese
Recipes.steps:
Slice chicken, bell peppers, and onion into strips. Mince garlic. Chop cilantro and cut lime wedges.
Heat oil in a pan. Sauté garlic briefly, then add chicken strips and season with chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook until chicken is nearly done. Add bell peppers and onion and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
Warm the flour tortillas on a pan or in the oven.
Place chicken and vegetables on tortillas. Top with shredded cheese, cilantro, and sour cream. Squeeze lime over the top before serving.

Recipes.ingredients: spinach,paneer,onion,garlic,ginger,green chili,tomato,cumin seeds,garam masala,turmeric,chili powder,salt,oil,cream (optional)
Recipes.steps:
Wash and chop spinach. Dice onion, tomato, and green chili. Mince garlic and ginger. Cut paneer into cubes.
Blanch spinach in boiling water for 2–3 minutes, then drain and blend into a smooth puree.
Heat oil in a pan, sauté cumin seeds until fragrant. Add onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili. Cook until golden. Add tomato, turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes soften.
Add spinach puree to the pan and simmer for a few minutes. Gently fold in paneer cubes and cook until heated through. Add cream if desired.
Garnish with a drizzle of cream or a pinch of garam masala. Serve hot with naan or steamed rice.

Recipes.ingredients: beef,coconut milk,Massaman curry paste,potato,onion,peanuts,tamarind paste,fish sauce,sugar,cinnamon stick,cardamom pods,oil,steamed rice
Recipes.steps:
Cut beef into cubes. Peel and cube potatoes. Slice onion. Prepare peanuts and measure curry paste.
Heat oil in a pot, sauté Massaman curry paste until fragrant.
Add half the coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Add beef cubes and cook until partially done.
Add potatoes, onion, peanuts, tamarind paste, fish sauce, sugar, cinnamon stick, and cardamom pods. Simmer until beef is tender and potatoes are cooked through.
Pour in remaining coconut milk if needed, adjust seasoning to taste. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Recipes.ingredients: shortcrust pastry,eggs,heavy cream,milk,bacon,onion,Gruyère cheese,nutmeg,salt,black pepper,butter
Recipes.steps:
Preheat oven. Chop bacon and onion. Grate Gruyère cheese.
Sauté bacon and onion in butter until lightly browned.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, cream, milk, nutmeg, salt, and black pepper.
Place pastry in a tart pan. Spread bacon and onion over the base, sprinkle Gruyère cheese, then pour the egg mixture over.
Bake in a preheated oven until the custard is set and top is golden brown.
Let cool slightly, slice, and serve warm or at room temperature.

Recipes.ingredients: all-purpose flour,baking powder,sugar,salt,milk,egg,butter,vanilla extract,maple syrup,cooking oil
Recipes.steps:
In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt. In another bowl, whisk milk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract. Combine wet and dry ingredients until smooth.
Heat a lightly oiled pan over medium heat. Pour batter to form pancakes. Cook until bubbles form on top, then flip and cook the other side until golden.
Stack pancakes on a plate and serve hot with maple syrup or toppings of choice.

Recipes.ingredients: bulgur wheat,parsley,mint,tomato,cucumber,green onion,lemon juice,olive oil,salt,black pepper
Recipes.steps:
Soak bulgur wheat in water until soft, then drain. Finely chop parsley, mint, tomato, cucumber, and green onion.
Combine bulgur, chopped herbs, and vegetables in a large bowl.
Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper together.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss well. Serve fresh as a side dish or light main.

Recipes.ingredients: rice cakes (tteok),fish cakes,gochujang (Korean chili paste),gochugaru (Korean chili flakes),garlic,onion,green onion,soy sauce,sugar,water,sesame oil,sesame seeds
Recipes.steps:
Slice rice cakes if needed. Cut fish cakes into bite-sized pieces. Chop onion and green onion. Mince garlic.
In a pan, mix water, gochujang, gochugaru, soy sauce, sugar, and garlic. Bring to a simmer.
Add rice cakes and fish cakes to the sauce. Simmer until rice cakes are soft and sauce thickens.
Add chopped green onions, drizzle sesame oil, and sprinkle sesame seeds on top. Serve hot.

Recipes.ingredients: rice vermicelli noodles,pork shoulder or pork belly,garlic,shallots,lemongrass,fish sauce,sugar,lime,chili,lettuce,cucumber,bean sprouts,Thai basil,peanuts,oil
Recipes.steps:
Slice pork thinly. Mince garlic, shallots, and lemongrass. Chop lettuce, cucumber, and herbs. Toast peanuts.
Mix pork with garlic, shallots, lemongrass, fish sauce, sugar, lime juice, and chili. Marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Grill or pan-fry the marinated pork until cooked and slightly caramelized.
Cook rice vermicelli noodles according to package instructions. Prepare lettuce, cucumber, bean sprouts, and herbs.
Place noodles in a bowl, top with grilled pork, fresh vegetables, herbs, and toasted peanuts. Serve with fish sauce-based dressing.

Recipes.ingredients: spaghetti,pancetta or guanciale,eggs,Parmesan cheese,Pecorino Romano cheese,garlic,black pepper,salt,olive oil
Recipes.steps:
Cook spaghetti in salted water until al dente. Dice pancetta or guanciale. Mince garlic. Grate Parmesan and Pecorino cheeses.
Heat olive oil in a pan, sauté pancetta until crispy. Add garlic briefly and remove from heat.
Beat eggs in a bowl and mix with grated cheeses and black pepper.
Drain pasta and add it to the pan with pancetta. Remove from heat, then quickly mix in the egg and cheese mixture to create a creamy sauce without scrambling the eggs.
Serve immediately with extra grated cheese and black pepper on top.

Posts.title: Pinot Noir Grape
Posts.content:
Back in 2012, we hosted a wine event with the world-renowned vineyard Chateau d’Yquem, for which our chefs and sommelier collaborated to create a dish that captured the aroma and flavour profile of what noble rot—Botrytis Cinerea—develops in their legendary Sauternes. The complexity of the wine was matched by the complexity of the dish: the recipe has 55 stages in its preparation.

This year, we’re hosting another prestigious wine dinner, with the equally world-renowned vineyard, Domaine de la Romanée-Conti. In honour of their expression of the Pinot Noir grape, Heston and his development team, pastry chefs and sommeliers were busy creating a brand-new version of this epic dessert, this time inspired by the complex characteristics of Pinot Noir.

Pinot Noir Grape will be featured on our à la carte menu from 18th July.

Recipes.ingredients: soft tofu,ground pork,garlic,ginger,green onion,doubanjiang (fermented chili bean paste),soy sauce,chili flakes,Sichuan peppercorn,chicken broth,cornstarch,oil,sugar
Recipes.steps:
Cut tofu into cubes. Mince garlic, ginger, and green onion. Measure chili paste, soy sauce, and chicken broth.
Heat oil in a pan, stir-fry ground pork until browned. Add garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant.
Stir in doubanjiang, chili flakes, soy sauce, sugar, and chicken broth. Simmer briefly.
Gently add tofu cubes, simmer for a few minutes. Mix cornstarch with water and stir in to thicken the sauce.
Sprinkle chopped green onion and crushed Sichuan peppercorn on top. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Recipes.ingredients: sushi rice,nori sheets,fresh salmon,cucumber,avocado,rice vinegar,sugar,salt,soy sauce,wasabi,pickled ginger
Recipes.steps:
Cook sushi rice and season with a mixture of rice vinegar, sugar, and salt. Let it cool slightly.
Slice fresh salmon, cucumber, and avocado into thin strips.
Place a nori sheet on a bamboo mat. Spread a thin layer of rice over the nori, leaving the top edge free. Arrange salmon, cucumber, and avocado along the bottom edge.
Roll tightly using the bamboo mat, pressing gently to shape. Slice into bite-sized pieces with a sharp, wet knife.
Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger on the side.

Posts.title: Pinot Noir Grape
Posts.content:
Back in 2012, we hosted a wine event with the world-renowned vineyard Chateau d’Yquem, for which our chefs and sommelier collaborated to create a dish that captured the aroma and flavour profile of what noble rot—Botrytis Cinerea—develops in their legendary Sauternes. The complexity of the wine was matched by the complexity of the dish: the recipe has 55 stages in its preparation.

This year, we’re hosting another prestigious wine dinner, with the equally world-renowned vineyard, Domaine de la Romanée-Conti. In honour of their expression of the Pinot Noir grape, Heston and his development team, pastry chefs and sommeliers were busy creating a brand-new version of this epic dessert, this time inspired by the complex characteristics of Pinot Noir.

Pinot Noir Grape will be featured on our à la carte menu from 18th July.

Recipes.ingredients: chicken pieces,onion,garlic,ginger,chili paste,tomato ketchup,coconut milk,turmeric powder,chili powder,salt,sugar,cooking oil,cilantro (for garnish)
Recipes.steps:
Chop onion, garlic, and ginger. Prepare chicken pieces and measure out spices and chili paste.
Heat oil in a pan and brown the chicken pieces lightly on all sides. Remove and set aside.
Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add chili paste, tomato ketchup, turmeric, chili powder, salt, and sugar. Cook until the sauce thickens slightly.
Return chicken to the pan, pour in coconut milk, and simmer until the chicken is fully cooked and the sauce is rich and thick.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with steamed rice.

Posts.content:

Recipes.ingredients: flour tortillas,ground beef,onion,garlic,black beans,cooked rice,cumin,chili powder,paprika,salt,black pepper,shredded cheese,sour cream,salsa,lettuce,oil
Recipes.steps:
Chop onion and garlic. Rinse black beans. Grate cheese and shred lettuce.
Heat oil in a pan, sauté onion and garlic until fragrant. Add ground beef, cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper. Cook until beef is browned.
Warm flour tortillas. Place cooked beef, rice, black beans, cheese, and lettuce on each tortilla.
Fold the sides over and roll tightly to enclose the filling.
Serve with sour cream and salsa on the side.

Recipes.ingredients: potato,cauliflower,onion,garlic,ginger,tomato,green chili,turmeric,cumin seeds,coriander powder,garam masala,chili powder,salt,oil,cilantro
Recipes.steps:
Peel and cube potatoes. Cut cauliflower into florets. Chop onion, tomato, garlic, ginger, and green chili.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds until fragrant. Sauté onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili until golden.
Add turmeric, coriander powder, chili powder, and salt. Stir briefly, then add potatoes and cauliflower. Mix well.
Cover and cook on low heat until vegetables are tender. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Add chopped tomato and garam masala. Cook for a few more minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with roti or rice.

Recipes.ingredients: shrimp or chicken,lemongrass,kaffir lime leaves,galangal,mushrooms,tomato,onion,chili,fish sauce,lime juice,cilantro,chicken or vegetable broth,sugar,oil
Recipes.steps:
Slice mushrooms, tomato, and onion. Bruise lemongrass and galangal. Tear kaffir lime leaves. Chop cilantro and chili.
Heat oil in a pot, sauté onion, lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves until fragrant. Add broth and bring to a boil.
Add shrimp or chicken and mushrooms. Simmer until protein is cooked through.
Add fish sauce, lime juice, and a pinch of sugar. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and sliced chili. Serve hot.

Recipes.recipeName: Coq au Vin (Chicken in Red Wine)
Recipes.ingredients: chicken pieces,red wine,bacon,onion,garlic,carrot,mushroom,thyme,bay leaf,flour,butter,oil,salt,black pepper,parsley
Recipes.steps:
Chop onion, garlic, carrot, and mushrooms. Cut bacon into small pieces. Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a large pan. Brown chicken pieces on all sides, then remove. Cook bacon until slightly crisp.
Add onion, garlic, carrot, and mushrooms to the pan. Sauté until softened.
Sprinkle flour over the vegetables and stir. Pour in red wine, add thyme and bay leaf, and simmer until thickened.
Return chicken to the pan and cook over low heat until fully cooked and tender.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve hot with mashed potatoes or crusty bread.

Recipes.ingredients: romaine lettuce,Parmesan cheese,croutons,garlic,anchovy fillets,lemon juice,Dijon mustard,olive oil,egg yolk,Worcestershire sauce,black pepper,salt
Recipes.steps:
Wash and chop romaine lettuce. Grate Parmesan cheese. Mince garlic and anchovy fillets.
Whisk together minced garlic, anchovy, egg yolk, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, olive oil, salt, and black pepper until smooth.
Toss lettuce with croutons, Parmesan cheese, and the dressing until evenly coated.
Serve immediately as a starter or side dish.

Recipes.ingredients: chickpeas,tahini,garlic,lemon juice,olive oil,salt,cumin,paprika,parsley
Recipes.steps:
Drain and rinse chickpeas. Peel garlic. Juice the lemon. Chop parsley for garnish.
In a food processor, blend chickpeas, tahini, garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and cumin until smooth. Add a little water if needed for consistency.
Spoon hummus into a bowl, drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle paprika, and garnish with chopped parsley. Serve with pita bread or fresh vegetables.

Chefs.biography: Odette is Royer’s first venture as Chef-Owner and has since become a prominent dining destination in Singapore. Royer’s culinary philosophy is deeply influenced by his respect for seasonality, terroir, and artisanal produce, with a cooking style that highlights the natural flavors of ingredients through a delicate, restrained approach. His years of experience in Asia have also influenced his cuisine, adding a sense of place to his dishes.

Nigel NG is the alter-ego of Uncle Roger. He performed the former 'Rice to Meet You' podcast (Now 'HAIYAA with Nigel Ng') and is Uncle Roger's supposed camera person. He runs comedy videos on YouTube and other platforms, and it has become viral. He is a food critic as Uncle Roger and edits the 'weejios.' Uncle Roger is an online personality made up by him and before that, he was a Malaysian stand-up comedian.

Datuk Dr. Redzuawan bin Ismail, universally celebrated as Chef Wan, is Malaysia’s first celebrity chef and national culinary icon. As Tourism Malaysia’s food ambassador, Chef Wan has spent more than two decades on the sets of international food television shows. He has cooked for high-profile figures such as the Sultan of Brunei and Bill Clinton.

His cuisine draws deeply from the Mediterranean Sea and the Montgó Natural Park, reflecting the region’s cultural and natural richness. Known worldwide for his artistic and innovative approach to gastronomy, Dacosta merges tradition with avant-garde techniques, showcasing local ingredients to create dishes that stimulate all the senses. His latest menu, „Por amor al arte II,” exemplifies his philosophy of combining aesthetics, emotion, and culinary excellence.

To understand Anne-Sophie Pic’s cuisine, one must understand Anne-Sophie Pic the woman. She is passionate, sensitive, free and determined. Her path exemplifies a unique strength of character, for as a self-taught woman, much conviction, perseverance and faith were asked of her in order to establish herself in a firmly male-dominated universe. She began her journey guided by her palate and sense of smell. When she enters the kitchen, she relies solely on her emotions and intuitions to create her dishes. She learns technique through practice, which affords her the immense freedom to associate tastes, to create her own style, and to seek balance and precision in all things.

From a young age, Yannick Alléno was immersed in the bistro run by his parents, where he spent much of his time. From this bistro, he learned the values of sharing, conviviality, and the counter that invites dialogue.

Trained by some of the greatest Meilleurs Ouvriers de France, such as Gabriel Biscay and Roland Durand, they taught him the discipline and precision of the craft. He then continued his journey at the Louis XIII under the direction of Manuel Martinez, where he honed his techniques and developed a culinary vision focused on excellence, before joining the Drouant alongside Louis Grondard, who deeply influenced him by instilling respect for French gastronomic traditions.

Inspired by Auguste Escoffier, Yannick Alléno doesn't hesitate to revisit the fundamentals and transform this heritage to create his own interpretation. This laid the foundation for a truly distinctive cuisine: Modern Cuisine. He brought sauces back to the forefront, designed using processes like extraction, fermentation, and cryoconcentration, to capture the essence of flavors and allow ingredients to interact.

Posts.title: Three Knives Best Chef Award!
Posts.content:
Our warmest congratulations to @chef_julien on being awarded Three Knives once again by @thebestchefawards.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we’ve long admired from around the world.

As we take this time to refresh our space and experience, this honour is a timely reminder of why we do what we do—and it fills us with hope and inspiration for the season ahead.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we’re busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that’s going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you’re a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is “largest gathering of Uncle Rogers”. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We’re all really proud of the food we’re putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger’s fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I’m also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you’re in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we’ll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

Coup de cœur pour les amandes et la pâte de figue de Loulou, la roquette de Pierre, les tomates des sœurs Risso et bien évidemment le miel de Boris Lerebours.

ChefApplications.biography: Nigel NG is the alter-ego of Uncle Roger. He performed the former 'Rice to Meet You' podcast (Now 'HAIYAA with Nigel Ng') and is Uncle Roger's supposed camera person. He runs comedy videos on YouTube and other platforms, and it has become viral. He is a food critic as Uncle Roger and edits the 'weejios.' Uncle Roger is an online personality made up by him and before that, he was a Malaysian stand-up comedian.

Datuk Dr. Redzuawan bin Ismail, universally celebrated as Chef Wan, is Malaysia’s first celebrity chef and national culinary icon. As Tourism Malaysia’s food ambassador, Chef Wan has spent more than two decades on the sets of international food television shows. He has cooked for high-profile figures such as the Sultan of Brunei and Bill Clinton.

Posts.title: Invitation to an exceptional gastronomic journey
Posts.content:
On November 13th and 14th, @lemeuricealainducasse restaurant will host a unique four-hand dinner, conceived by the Dom Pérignon Society chefs, @amaurybouhours and @qiqedacosta , alongside Maison @domperignonofficial .
Following an initial encounter in Spain, a unique sensory experience will come to life, highlighting the dialogue between haute French and Spanish cuisine around tactility, inspired by Dom Pérignon vintages.
A celebration of excellence and creativity. ✨

Enjoy responsibly

ChefApplications.biography: His cuisine draws deeply from the Mediterranean Sea and the Montgó Natural Park, reflecting the region’s cultural and natural richness. Known worldwide for his artistic and innovative approach to gastronomy, Dacosta merges tradition with avant-garde techniques, showcasing local ingredients to create dishes that stimulate all the senses. His latest menu, „Por amor al arte II,” exemplifies his philosophy of combining aesthetics, emotion, and culinary excellence.

Posts.title: Nid d’abeille
Posts.content: Le Chocolat en alvéole, thé hojicha cubebe, miel amer de Corse.

ChefApplications.biography: To understand Anne-Sophie Pic’s cuisine, one must understand Anne-Sophie Pic the woman. She is passionate, sensitive, free and determined. Her path exemplifies a unique strength of character, for as a self-taught woman, much conviction, perseverance and faith were asked of her in order to establish herself in a firmly male-dominated universe. She began her journey guided by her palate and sense of smell. When she enters the kitchen, she relies solely on her emotions and intuitions to create her dishes. She learns technique through practice, which affords her the immense freedom to associate tastes, to create her own style, and to seek balance and precision in all things.

Posts.title: Cooking with Bro
Posts.content:
Dans les coulisses de notre cuisine La Table de Pavie ✨ .
Voici un aperçu de la magie qui opère derrière le passe : entre passion, précision et créativité. Les chefs @yannickalleno et @sebastien_faramond_ véritables architectes du goût, mettent un point d’honneur à équilibrer les saveurs, à soigner les cuissons, et surtout... à maîtriser l’art des sauces .

ChefApplications.biography:
From a young age, Yannick Alléno was immersed in the bistro run by his parents, where he spent much of his time. From this bistro, he learned the values of sharing, conviviality, and the counter that invites dialogue.

Trained by some of the greatest Meilleurs Ouvriers de France, such as Gabriel Biscay and Roland Durand, they taught him the discipline and precision of the craft. He then continued his journey at the Louis XIII under the direction of Manuel Martinez, where he honed his techniques and developed a culinary vision focused on excellence, before joining the Drouant alongside Louis Grondard, who deeply influenced him by instilling respect for French gastronomic traditions.

Inspired by Auguste Escoffier, Yannick Alléno doesn't hesitate to revisit the fundamentals and transform this heritage to create his own interpretation. This laid the foundation for a truly distinctive cuisine: Modern Cuisine. He brought sauces back to the forefront, designed using processes like extraction, fermentation, and cryoconcentration, to capture the essence of flavors and allow ingredients to interact.

Posts.title: Pinot Noir Grape
Posts.content:
Back in 2012, we hosted a wine event with the world-renowned vineyard Chateau d’Yquem, for which our chefs and sommelier collaborated to create a dish that captured the aroma and flavour profile of what noble rot—Botrytis Cinerea—develops in their legendary Sauternes. The complexity of the wine was matched by the complexity of the dish: the recipe has 55 stages in its preparation.

This year, we’re hosting another prestigious wine dinner, with the equally world-renowned vineyard, Domaine de la Romanée-Conti. In honour of their expression of the Pinot Noir grape, Heston and his development team, pastry chefs and sommeliers were busy creating a brand-new version of this epic dessert, this time inspired by the complex characteristics of Pinot Noir.

Pinot Noir Grape will be featured on our à la carte menu from 18th July.

Posts.title: Three Knives Best Chef Award!
Posts.content:
Our warmest congratulations to @chef_julien on being awarded Three Knives once again by @thebestchefawards.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we’ve long admired from around the world.

As we take this time to refresh our space and experience, this honour is a timely reminder of why we do what we do—and it fills us with hope and inspiration for the season ahead.
